strIntroduction: This tour visits Wakayama which is located in the Kansai region of Honshu below Osaka, staying at Katsuura Hot Springs. This places could be considered a hidden gem as the area isn't packed with Japanese tourists, so there are many places you can enjoy and experience its local culture without the bustle of other similar popular destinations. Itinerary: Board the bus at your chosen location. Okayama Bypass Parking Area Okayama Station Southern Parking Ryobi Bus Kurashiki Ryobi Bus Sanyo Parking Area Detox Ohashi Onsen Yamakou Bus Stop Souvenir and discount giveaway on the bus. Hidaka Sample a classic Kishu Hanaemaki gozen lunch. Umeboshi factory See how the famous dried fruit is made in Wakayama and enjoy a tasting too. Hashigui Rocks This mythological point has standing rocks that trace out a low tide bridge to a nearby island. Their unique formation makes for fabulous pictures. 16:45 Minami Katsuura Hot springs Check-in to the Katsuura Gyoen and enjoy dinner prepared with local ingredients. Bathe in the open air style hot spring baths and relax to soak away your troubles. Dinner Menu Seasonal Appetizers Kishuu Regional Sushi Fresh sashimi Harihari Hot Pot Chawan-mushi Seasonal dishes Seasonal tempura Seasonal grilled fish Wagui Beef served on a Ceramic Plate Katsuura Nanbantsuke Pickles and rice Soup Dessert Day 2 Breakfast Tanize Hanging Bridge Step onto this hanging bridge, which is seemingly delicately suspended over the Totsukawa river. The bridge soars through the sky for 297 meters and is 54 meters above the waters below. Gojo (Lunch) Stop and try the regional persimmon leaf wrapped sushi, a delicacy handed down through centuries. Michi no Eki Rest Stop (Shopping) Pick up some local souvenirs and tasty treats while you stretch your legs Sanada Museum Welcome to the Sanada Museum, and glimpse at the samurai of old. Also featured are props from popular TV dramas based around the Sanada clan's history. 19:00 Drop off at your chosen location. Final stop is Okayama Station South Parking.
strTitle: Enjoy Overnight Hot Spring Tour in Kishu-Katsuura, Wakayama

strIntroduction: This is a budget friendly tour around Mt. Fuji where there are a lot of attractions to enjoy with a view of nature, and the walking. Mt. Fuji is not only the highest mountain peak in Japan and the symbol of this country, it has also been worshiped as a sacred mountain as well. You will see the history and magnificent nature Mt. Fuji has to offer. Schedule: 09:00-09:10 Pick-up at K's House Mt. Fuji or Kawaguchiko Station Kitaguchi Hongu Fuji Sengen Shrine Fuji Sengen Shrine is a historical shrine constructed in 788. Located in the thick cedar forest at the bottom of Mt Fuji it serves as a sacred spot for the worship and pilgrimage of Mount Fuji. It also leads visitors to the Yoshidaguchi climbing trail. 5th Station of Mount Fuji (2305 meters) The 5th station of Mt.Fuji is a major base for climbing Mount Fuji. Full of restaurants and shops, it is usually bustling with mountain climbers, cyclists, and tourists taking photos of the spectacular view from 2305 meters above sea level. Oniwa / Okuniwa (4.5 Level) Okuniwa is located between the 4th and 5th level stations of Mount Fuji and is part of the circular Ochudou trail. Okuniwa has a unique landscape view as it lies on the border of a forest and the volcanic mountain. It is considered the boundary between heaven and earth. Back to Kawaguchiko Station and K's House Mt Fuji Please have lunch on your own. 14:00 Board at K's House Mt Fuji 14:05 Board at Kawaguchiko Station Walk in Aokigahara Jukai (Lava forest) This wind cave is located on the Shoji-guchi trail, which is one of the best preserved trails around Mt.Fuji. The nature around the trail is wild creating a mysterious atmosphere, Shiraito Falls (part of the Mt,Fuji World Cultural Heritage Site) Located in the southwestern foothills of Mt.Fuji this 200 meter wide cascade is fed by white streams that resemble hanging threads of silk. Lake Motosuko Motosuko is the deepest of the Fuji Five Lakes at about 138 metes at its deepest point and the scenery on the back of the 1000 yen bill is a picture of Lake Motosuko with Mount Fuji in the background. Oishi Park (if time allows) Witness the gorgeous view of Mt. Fuji and Lake Kawaguchi from the north shore of the lake. 17:30-17:40 Drop-off at K's House Mt. Fuji or Kawaguchiko Station
strTitle: Budget Tour of Mt. Fuji and surroundings from Lake Kawaguchi

strIntroduction: This is a relaxed tour that goes around Mt.Fuji for 3 days starting from Okayama and traveling to Yamanashi. You will see the mountain from 2 prefectures and stay 2 nights in different hotels. There are lots of sightseeing spots that you can take time to explore. You will experience the "take care of all your needs" Japanese hospitality which is called " Omotenashi" during your stay. Schedule: Day 1 06:15-07:40 Board the bus at your chosen location in Okayama Lunch Lunch will be a boxed lunch served onboard the bus. Itchiku Kubota Art Museum Bringing the three aspects of People, Nature, and Art together, this museum has with works from Itchiku Kubota based on themes of culture and design. 17:00 Lake Kawaguchi Hot Springs Check in to a Provence styled hotel, the La Vista. Boasting views of Mt.Fuji, relax and enjoy yourself. Dinner Dine on Southern French cuisine prepared using seasonal and local ingredients. The special tomato ramen is a treat to your senses. Day 2 Breakfast 09:30 Depart Hotel Ooishi Park Located on the north coast of Lake Kawaguchi this national park offers a huge spreading view of the lake and Mount Fuji. Higashiyama Kyu Kishitei Visit the old residence of Prime Minister Kishitei and check out the traditional sweet shop Doraya nearby Gotenba (Lunch) Mishima skywalk The longest suspension bridge in Japan, this 400 meter pathway through the sky boasts fabulous views of Mt.Fuji. Kanzanji Hot Springs - Hotel Kokonoe Check in and let the day's travels and tiredness slip away at this classic Japanese style inn. Day 3 Breakfast 09:30 Hotel Departure Kanzanji Ropeway and Ookusayama Observatory Travel on the only ropeway cable car in Japan that traverses the waters of a lake, then enjoy the 360 degree panorama from the observatory. Unagi Pie Factory Established in Hamamatsu in 1961, the Unagi Pie quickly became a popular souvenir and snack. Try the crispy sweet for yourself. Hamamatsu (Lunch) Ryoutanji Temple Pay a visit to this historical temple and enjoy the serene gardens as well. Drop off at your chosen location. Final stop is Okayama Station South Parking.
strTitle: Relax on a 3 Days & 2 Nights Mt.Fuji Tour from Okayama

strIntroduction: This tour is short but interesting. Starting with the Atami Ropeway it will take in a view of the whole city before going to Kinomiya Shrine which is famous for a 2,000 year old tree growing there. The third stop is Atami Ume Garden or Himenosawa Park. Depending on the season this tour will go to different places to make sure of the best view of Atami. Finally, the tour will head to Jikkoku Mountain Pass with an overlooking view of Mt. Fuji when the weather is good enough. Here are the details: 1. Check-in Check-in at the Atami Station Sightseeing Bus Counter at 09:30. 2. Omiya's Pine Tree View from the bus window. 3. Korakuen (Atami Ropeway) Take the ropeway for 30 minutes and take some great photos. 4. Kinomiya Shrine Arrive at Kinomiya Shrine and visit for 20 minutes. 5. Atami Ume Garden or Himenosawa Park We will visit Atami Ume Garden between late November and mid-March. 6. Atami Ume Garden or Himenosawa Park We will visit Himenosawa Park during the other times of the year. 7. Jikkoku Mountain Pass Head to Jikkoku Mountain Pass and visit for 30 minutes. Option 1: Adult Option 2: Child Attention: 1. The entrance fee for Atami Ume Garden changes during the plum festival. 2. The tour could be delayed depending on the traffic or weather conditions. 3. The tour includes a Japanese-speaking guide. There is no English-speaking guide but simple instructions regarding get off spots and times may be given in simple English.
strTitle: Enjoy a Half Day Tour Including Ropeway and Shrine in Atami

strIntroduction: Offering beaches, resorts, together with mountainous sceneries, Shodoshima Island in Seto Inland Sea is well-known for its Mediterranean atmosphere. Traditionally known for producing soy sauce, now the island is even better known for the biggest olive cultivation in Japan. On this tour you can visit the 500 or so, wild and playful monkeys that currently inhabit the area known as the Monkey Kingdom. Visit Kankakei Summit, one of three of the most beautiful gorges in Japan and enjoy the breathtaking view from the observation decks along the ropeway while having lunch. Visit Nijushi no Hitomi Movie Village, a 30-year-old movie set with old fashioned backgrounds and a nostalgic atmosphere. End the tour by visiting an olive garden and discover all the ways olives are used or soak your skin in an olive bath.
strTitle: One Day Tour to Shodoshima Island and Monkey Kingdom

strIntroduction: There is nothing more perfect than escaping from the hectic bustle of Tokyo to the peaceful and breathtaking natural scenery of the Northern Japan Alps! On this 3 day tour you will have a chance to ride the newest bullet train in Japan, the Hakutaka, that only began operating in March 2016! This green journey starts from the famous hot spring town of Unazuki before taking a ride on the Kurobe Gorge Train affording views of the rocky river bed surrounded by natural hot springs. Take time to enjoy the hot springs and dinner with their local tastes. On the second day explore the Tateyama Alpine Route. For tours booked before June 22nd, you may be able to see the colossal snow corridors in Otani! Continue until you reach Daikanbo, the peak of the Tateyama Alpine Route and view the mountainous areas that surround. After that, the tour visits Kurobe Dam, the tallest dam in Japan, which also serves as a major hydro power plant. The last day ends at Kamikochi, where you can explore its vast mountainous areas surrounded by forests and lakes. Please note that the tour is for Japanese citizens and basically operated in Japanese. Although we have staff speaking both English and Chinese, only basic information is provided, not a detailed guide about the sights.
strTitle: Embark on a 3-Day Tour to Explore the Northern Japan Alps

strIntroduction: Spa Resort Hawaiians is a one-stop water park, onsen and entertainment facility with a Hawaiian theme. It is located in Iwaki, Fukushima prefecture, and was formerly known as Joban Hawaiian Center. Inaugurated in 1966, it was the first theme park to be built in Japan. Over the years, the resort had been upgraded to meet with the times, and it is still a highly visited destination. The most famous attraction of the resort is the Hawaiian dance performance by the hula girls, the dance team whose name is synonymous with the resort ever since it opened. In the 1960s, Iwaki was a coal mining town that faced a crisis when oil became the predominant energy source in Japan. The resort was built and the hula girls entertained to draw in tourists - the new source of income for the town. The water park is the main area where the indoor pools, water slides, and the dance stage are located. Here, a Hawaiian atmosphere is recreated with pineapple plants and other tropical elements, along with staff and hotel guests in Hawaiian outfits. Step outdoors and you will find Spa Garden Pareo, a water playground with outdoor pools, deckchairs, jacuzzis and a sauna (closed in winter). The Spring Park is one of two hot spring areas that draw their spring water from Yumoto Onsen. It features lukewarm indoor pools where both genders can enjoy a dip in swimsuits, as well as regular, gender separated hot spring baths where swimsuits are not allowed. The other hot spring area is Edo Jowa Yoichi, a gender separated, large outdoor bath with an Edo Period theme, which is said to be the largest single outdoor bath in Japan. The bath and surroundings are wonderfully designed to provide an authentic onsen experience. A 15-minute shadow show (kage shibai) is performed every night so that guests can enjoy whilst taking a hot bath. Why not take a trip from central Tokyo to Spa Resort Hawaiians? The tour fare includes the round trip JR express ticket (day trip) and admission to Spa Resort Hawaiians. There is also a free shuttle bus between Yumoto Station and Spa Resort Hawaiians. Bring your own swimsuit and towel for bathing.
strTitle: Swim & Bathe in Spa Resort Hawaiians in Iwaki!

strIntroduction: The stone-built townscape and the flower garden that make up the world of “Heidi, Girl of the Alps”, illuminates an exotic atmosphere. In the streets suggestive of Switzerland, beautiful seasonal flowers, such as tulips, iris germanica, roses, lavenders, and sunflowers bloom. Events such as a fireworks display and an illumination exhibition are held in summer and winter. Enjoy the world of Heidi, in the themed facilities of Heidi, Café Rottenmeier, and the restaurant “Volcano.” On the grounds of the center, which have been built to resemble those of a European farm village, everyone from families and couples can enjoy features such as the 15-meter-tall observation tower, the flower garden, including roses and tulips, the maze of sunflowers and a children’s playground. There are also many events during the year with nighttime illumination during the summer holidays and Christmas season. It is truly the world of Heidi with Mt. Fuji, Mt. Yatsugatake and the Southern Alps surrounding the village. One of the highlights of Heidi’s Village is the huge number of roses. And annually in June, 2,300 roses representing 430 varieties bloom all at once. The 230-meter rose corridor is the longest in Japan where you can enjoy the beauty of the many different colors of rose including white and yellow; you can then take in their elegant fragrance. You are also able to board the bus that operates through the large village and even try the segways which run through the flower fields and off-road. Why not take a trip from central Tokyo to Heidi's Village? The tour fare includes the round trip JR express ticket (day trip), admission to Heidi's Village, and Den-en Bus between Nirasaki Station and Heidi's Village. The omurice (omelette rice) lunch is also included. It can be changed to a popular cheese fondue buffet, with an additional fee per person.
strTitle: Walk Through Beautiful Flowers in Heidi's Village, Yamanashi

strIntroduction: Kamogawa Sea World is an amusement park with a collection of 11,000 marine creatures from 800 different species. In the themed display zones, visitors can come into contact with these creatures in environments that replicate as closely as possible their marine habitats. This includes things such as an eco-aquarium, which recreates the habitats in Japanese rivers as they flow to the sea, a tropical island which displays tropical coral and South Pacific fish, and an enormous shore reef, where a variety of marine mammals and penguins live. Prepare to be surprised and impressed as killer whales jump energetically and toss their trainer into the air, while beluga and dolphins achieve startling feats in the water, and sea lions perform a uniquely comic show. Other attractions include the pelicans going for their daily walk, night adventures, and areas where you can interact with the creatures, taking photographs with them and petting them. The park features the only restaurant in Japan where you can watch killer whales swimming past as you eat, as well as a restaurant overlooking the Pacific Ocean, making diners feel as though they are on a cruise ship. There are also a number of gift shops with an array of exclusive products. Why not take a trip from central Tokyo or urban Chiba to Kamogawa Sea World? The tour fare includes the round trip JR ticket (day trip), and admission to Kamogawa Sea World. You can also choose to include lunch at a reasonable price. There is a free shuttle bus between Awa-Kamogawa Station and Kamogawa Sea World. It takes approximately 10 minutes.
strTitle: Interact with Sea Animals in Kamogawa Sea World, Chiba!

strIntroduction: Kamikochi is a popular resort in the Northern Japan Alps of Nagano Prefecture, offering some of Japan's most spectacular mountainous scenery. It is open from mid/late April until November 15 and shuts down during winter. In 2016, Kamikochi is scheduled to be open until November 15. Kamikochi is a roughly 15-kilometer long plateau in the Azusa River Valley, about 1,500 meters above sea level. It is surrounded by tall mountains, including Nishihotakadake (2909 m), Okuhotakadake (3190 m), Maehotakadake (3090 m) and the active volcano Yakedake (2455 m). Part of the Chubu Sangaku National Park, Kamikochi has only been moderately developed with half a dozen hotels, a few souvenir shops, mountain huts and hiking trails. Private cars are banned from Kamikochi, and access is only possible by bus or taxi. Why not take a trip from central Tokyo to Kamikochi? The tour fare includes the round trip JR express ticket (day trip), and direct bus from Matsumoto to Kamikochi or train from Matsumoto to Shin-Shimashima + bus (You can choose whichever).
strTitle: Walk Around the Natural Environment of Kamikochi, Nagano

strIntroduction: Mother Farm, aka Mother Bokujo, is a fantastic family outing approximately 2 hours south of Tokyo in the verdant Chiba countryside. When you have had enough of Tokyo’s gray, the Boso Peninsula’s spring flora provides respite.The hills are alive with the sounds of barnyard animals. Mother Farm is a year-round destination, with a different character in different seasons. Why not take a trip from central Tokyo or urban Chiba to Mother Farm in Futtsu city? The tour fare includes a round trip JR ticket (day trip), admission to Mother Farm, and Mother Farm tour. You can also choose to include lunch at a reasonable price. * Mother Farm tour may be cancelled due to bad weather conditions. There is a free shuttle bus between Kimitsu Station and Mother Farm, but only one round trip a day. It takes approximately 40 minutes. If you miss or do not use the shuttle bus, you'll have to consider another transport option. Kimitsu Station South Exit at 10:40 Mother Farm at 15:30
strTitle: Touch and Play with Live Animals at Mother Farm, in Chiba!

Fuji's 2nd Station could be canceled depending on the weather. Though, we will visit either the Susono Municipal Mt. Fuji Museum, Mt. Fuji Juku-no Mori (Mt. Fuji Visitor Center Juku Forest Park), Iwamotoyama Park or other facility instead. 3. The 2nd Station of Mt. Fuji is about 5 to 10 degrees Celsius cooler than Tokyo. Please wear something warm. 4. The Nihondaira ropeway could be closed depending on the weather. Though, we will visit either Nihondaira Zoo, Seikenji Temple, Sunpujo Park, Shimizu Port Bay Cruise, Miho no Matsubara, Shiroito Falls, Fujisan Hongu Sengen Taisha Shrine, Mishima Taisha Shrine, Numazu Goyotei Memorial Park, etc. instead. 5. Children from 4 to 5 will be required pay an additional 500 JPY to the guide on the Nihondaira Ropeway. 6. Food allergy or other requirements must be made at least 2 business days before. 7. The tour could potentially be canceled if the minimum number of participants are not met.
strTitle: Experience a Full Day Tour of Mt. Fuji, from Kyoto

strIntroduction: This is a one day tour starting in Osaka that takes you to Shizuoka prefecture's most interesting sightseeing spots, including Mt. Fuji!. The tour ends in Tokyo. First, you will ride the modern Shinkansen bullet train at Shin-Osaka station and head to Shizuoka, where you will hop on a tour bus with an English-speaking guide. The first destination is Nihondaira, where you can enjoy a ropeway ride to Kuno-zan Toshogu shrine. You will board a 1,065 meter-long ropeway with breathtaking scenery of flowers, trees and Suruga Bay. Kuno-zan Toshogu shrine is a designated National Treasure and is dedicated to Ieyasu Tokugawa, a general from the Edo period. The shrine is built in the Gongen-zukuri style, which was a famous architectural style at the time. You'll be amazed by the extraordinary sculptures of the shrine. Nihondaira Ocha Kaikan (green tea hall) offers you a wonderful view of Mt. Fuji, Suruga Bay and a green tea field. Here, you can purchase green tea leaves, which make a great souvenir for your family and friends. At lunch, you will indulge in fresh fish caught at Suruga Bay and directly brought to the restaurant for you to enjoy in delicious sushi. After lunch, learn about Japanese art during the Edo period at Shizuoka City Tokaido Hiroshige Museum of Art, where you will admire the works of Hiroshige Utagawa, the last master of Ukiyo-e (woodblock prints). The highlight of the tour is visiting Mt. Fuji. The tour bus will take you to the 2nd station of Mt. Fuji, where you will be able to admire the magnificent view and take in a deep breath of pure mountain air. Finally, board the Tokaido Shinkansen to Tokyo, where you can continue your trip exploring Japan's capital. The tour is available on Sunday, Tuesday, Wednesday, Thursday and Friday and has a duration of 13 hours.
strTitle: One Day Tour to Mt. Fuji (starts in Osaka, ends in Tokyo)

strIntroduction: This 2-days Hiroshima and Kurashiki Tour starts at Kyoto Station and ends at Osaka. Visit famous tourist spots like Itsukushima Shrine, the Hiroshima Peace Memorial Park and Museum, the Atomic Bomb Dome, the Kurashiki Bikan Historical Quarter, the Ohara Museum of Art and Okayama Korakuen! On Day 1, you will visit the beautiful Itsukushima Shrine as well as historical places like the Hiroshima Peace Memorial Park and Museum, and the Atomic Bomb Dome. You will learn about the history of Japan and visit UNESCO World Heritage Sites! On Day 2, you will stroll around Kurashiki Bikan Historical Quarter including the Ohara Museum of Art and a visit to Okayama Korakuen. You will feel the traditional Japanese atmosphere and relax in the beautiful landscapes. All of the spots in this tour are worth a visit, if you'd like to learn the history of Japan, feel the traditional Japanese culture, and relax in beautiful natural spaces, don't miss the opportunity to visit the best spots in Hiroshima & Kurashiki area! The tour starts in Kyoto with a ride on the Shinkansen and ends in Osaka. This tour is available on Mondays, Wednesdays and Saturdays. The price includes: lunch on day 2, admission fee, transportation fee, English guide fee, accommodation fee, pick-up and drop-off service at designated hotels.
strTitle: Enjoy a 2-Days Hiroshima & Kurashiki Tour from Kyoto!

strIntroduction: This 2-days Hiroshima and Kurashiki Tour starts at Shin Osaka station and ends in Kyoto. Visit famous tourist spots like Itsukushima Shrine, the Hiroshima Peace Memorial Park and Museum, the Atomic Bomb Dome, the Kurashiki Bikan Historical Quarter, the Ohara Museum of Art and Okayama Korakuen! Your journey starts by riding the Shinkansen bullet train at Shin Osaka Station all the way to Hiroshima station. Then, take the ferry to the Miyajima and Itsukushima Shrine! Find your best spot for taking beautiful pictures of the famous floating shrine. In the afternoon you will visit Hiroshima Peace Memorial Park to learn about the history of japan at the Hiroshima Peace Memorial Museum and to see the Atomic Bomb Dome. On Day 2, stroll around Kurashiki Bikan Historical Quarter, where you can see traditional Japanese buildings, then visit the Ohara Museum of Art and visit Okayama Korakuen, considered one of the top 3 gardens in Japan! You will finish your journey with a shinkansen ride to Kyoto. This tour is available on Mondays, Wednesdays and Saturdays. The tour includes: lunch on day 2, admission fees, transportation fees, English-speaking guide fee, accommodation fee and pick-up and drop-off service at designated hotels.
strTitle: Enjoy a 2-Days Hiroshima & Kurashiki Tour from Osaka!

strIntroduction: In this two-day Hiroshima and Kurashiki tour from Kyoto, you can visit many popular sightseeing spots such as Miyajima, Itsukushima shrine, the Hiroshima Peace Memorial Park & Museum, the atomic bomb dome, Kurashiki Bikan Historical Quarter, Ohara Museum of Art and Okayama Korakuen. You will meet up with your guide at Kyoto Station, where you will ride the bullet train to take you to your first destination. The first day's sightseeing starts in Miyajima. You will visit the famous floating Itsukushima shrine, where the legend says, people and Gods live together. It's a must-visit landmark of Japan. In Hiroshima, you will visit Hiroshima Peace Memorial Park, which houses the Peace Memorial Museum and the atomic bomb dome. These historical spots are worth seeing to learn about the history of Japan. The second day starts with a visit to Kurashiki Bikan Historical Quarter, where you can see traditional Japanese buildings and admire modern art at Ohara Museum of Art. Next, you will visit Okayama Korakuen, which was awarded three Michelin stars and well-known as one of the three great gardens of Japan. Relax in the greenery at this cultural heritage site! This tour is available on Mondays, Wednesdays and Saturdays. The Price includes: lunch on day 2, admission fees, transportation fees, accommodation fees, and pick-up and drop-off service at designated hotels.
strTitle: Go on a Family 2-days Hiroshima & Kurashiki Tour from Kyoto!

strIntroduction: This is a 1 day tour that will take you to Hiroshima and Miyajima by Shinkansen bullet train from Kyoto with an English-speaking guide! You will visit Itsukushima shrine in Miyajima, the Peace memorial Park, the Peace Memorial Museum and the atomic bomb dome in Hiroshima. Don't miss the chance to explore the top 3 popular tourist attractions in Hiroshima and Miyajima! Miyajima is an island where, as the legend goes, people and Gods live together. It is one of the top three scenic spots in Japan and it is well-known for the floating Itsukushima shrine and its great Torii gate. Itsukushima shrine is a UNESCO World Heritage Site and it has more than 1400 years of history. At the time when Taira-no-Kiyomori began the construction of this shrine in 1168, it was an attempt to build the mythical Ryugu-jo (Dragon Palace), where the goddess of the sea lives. Hiroshima Peace Memorial Park is one of the most famous memorial parks in Japan. The park houses several historical buildings and monuments including the Peace Memorial Museum, the atomic bomb dome, and the Memorial cenotaph for the atomic bomb victims. The Peace Memorial Museum opened in 1955, with the purpose of showing the damage caused by atomic bomb, and promote the eradication of nuclear weapons. These are all must-visit places for visitors who want to know the history of Japan! This tour is available everyday except for Tuesdays and Thursdays.
strTitle: Explore Hiroshima & Miyajima by Shinkansen from Kyoto!

strIntroduction: The Tateyama Kurobe Alpine Route is best-known for its "snow wall" - the marvelous snow corridor formed by accumulated snow during the winter in this region. Now it serves as a route connecting Toyama city in Toyama prefecture with Omachi town in Nagano prefecture, as well as a local tourist attraction. But it's not only worth visiting in winter, visitors can also come to enjoy the beautiful landscapes in any season, you can enjoy alpine flowers in summer and the colors of the fall covering the entire slope during autumn too. Visitors can explore the Route in various means of transportation. Join our tour to discover this mountainous beauty with all transportation and accommodation fees included! We will first arrive at Kamikochi, where you can stroll around one of the finest mountain resorts in Japan before going to the hotel, where you can try the the local specialties for dinner and taking some rest. On the second day, we will visit Kurobe Dam, Japan's tallest dam with a height of 186 meters. From there, you will have the chance to experience all kinds of means of transportation, such as the cable car to Kurobedaira and the ropeway to Daikanbo, in order to reach Murodo, the highest point of the Tateyama Kurobe Alpine Route. You can spend a whole day enjoying the fantastic views of the surrounding mountainous neighborhood. Please note that this tour is for international visitors only. Dinner on day 2 and breakfast on day 3 are included in the tour booking price, but lunch on day 2 is not included. Vegetarian menus are available if requested during booking. Infant (age between 0 to 5 years old) could also join this tour for free.
strTitle: Explore the Tateyama Kurobe alpine route in a 3-day tour!

strIntroduction: This is a half day tour to the Ohya underground lake inside an old quarry. The lake was formed by rain water that was filtered through the ground into the old site of a quarry that was active for more than 67 years. It is more than 20,000 square meters and large enough to fit a baseball field. The quarry was well known in the area for being the site where a lot of the stones were took to build the Imperial Hotel designed by the master architect Frank Lloyd Wright. After a through inspection of the site conducted by the government, it was deemed safe for exploration, allowing only organized tour groups to visit the site, which remains off-limits to individual visitors. This mysterious place is near Utsunomiya, located two hours away from Tokyo by car and less than one hour by Shinkansen bullet train. The tour starts at 9:15, you will meet your guide at Michi no eki in Utsonomiya romantic mura at parking place number two, from where they will take you to the quarry. Pick-up is also available from Utsunomiya Station at 8:40 am. For afternoon tours the meeting time is 12:40 at Utsunomiya Station or 13:20 at Michi no eki. You will start by hiking the mountain of the quarry for approximately 500 meters, with amazing views, then, you will hop on a rafting boat in a 8 people group and paddle your way through the peaceful, and mysterious darkness of the underground lake. At some places the route can be thrilling because of the low ceiling. The light flickering in the darkness enhances the mysterious, fantastic atmosphere. After the tour, you will head back to Michi no Eki Utsunomiya romantic mura by bus and arrive around 12:40 pm (after 17:00 pm for afternoon tours). Take this unique opportunity of cruising an awe-inspiring space in silence and darkness and experience the wonderful world of the underground lake in the quarry.
strTitle: Experience the Ohya underground lake in a quarry by raft!

strIntroduction: In this tour you will be visiting 3 sake breweries, where you will be able to taste this delicious drink and learn all about the process of making sake, as well as how to pair it with delicious food. The starting point will be Kanazawa Station, from where the tour will depart towards the first stop, the Shirayama Hime Shrine, located in one of the holiest mountains in Japan, where you will be able to relax, take in the amazing scenery and take a deep breath of pure air as you explore the area. After the visit of the shrine, the real tour will start! You are going to visit three different Sake Breweries. You will have lunch at Takasago Saryo, a restaurant managed by a sake brewery, so there will be no doubt that the delicious French food will be perfectly paired with the sake. Here, you can also try Ama-zake (Sweet Sake) and purchase a bottle or two to take back home. Among of the sake breweries that you will visit is also Fukumitsuya, where besides having the opportunity to try their sake, you will also learn about their cosmetics as well. They are made with rice fermentation technology that produce very high quality products. The tour will end at Kanazawa Station at 15:30, which means you will still have a lot of time for shopping!
strTitle: Enjoy a 1 day sake breweries tour in Kanazawa, Ishikawa!

strIntroduction: Okinawa is Japan's southernmost prefecture, consisting of a few dozen, small islands in the southern half of the Nansei Shoto, the island chain which stretches over about one thousand kilometers from Kyushu to Taiwan. Okinawa is gaining international popularity. Coral reefs provide great snorkeling and diving spots, but if you prefer to see beautiful fish without getting wet, Okinawa also has a fine aquarium. This is a convenient one day bus tour that lets you explore some of the best Okinawa has to offer. The tour starts at 10:00 at Chatan Tourist Organizaion, and will head to Kouri Island, where you'll have time to explore the beautiful Kouri beach along with the lengthy bridge extending 1,960 meters across the sea. Enjoy the beautiful view of the turquoise blue sea. Then, from the bus, admire the Warumi Ohashi Bridge before reaching the Churaumi Aquarium, where you'll have 3 whole hours to explore thoroughly this impressive aquarium allowing you to discover the unique underwater life of Okinawa including the massive whale sharks and cute dolphins. The tour then moves on to Okinawa Fruits Land if you take the tour on an odd number day, where you can taste some unique tropical fruit that grow in Okinawa. if you take the tour on an even day, you will visit Nago Pineapple Park instead, where besides pineapples, you will also be able to try a variety of sweets, wines and many more products. You will also be able to ride on the pineapple kart to explore the farm. Finally, for an extra charge, you have the option to visit Kokusai street in Naha, where you can shop around for souvenirs and tasty treats!
strTitle: Enjoy a 1 day tour to most popular attractions in Okinawa

strIntroduction: Kanazawa city in Ishikawa prefecture is one of the historical castle towns in Japan. The city is also designated as one of creative cities Network by UNESCO. There are a lot of historical buildings, neighborhoods, gardens and traditional arts and crafts everywhere for you to admire. This tour will take you some of those places with a Japanese speaking guide. The starting point of the tour is in Kanazawa Station. From there, you will go to Shirayama Hime Shrine, located a top Shirayama mountain, which is one of the holy mountains in Japan. This is the perfect place to relax, take a deep breath of pure air and enjoy the natural beauty of the area. After the visit of the shrine, you will come back to town and visit Kobori Syuzou sake brewery, where you will have the opportunity to taste freshly brewed sake. After that, the next stop will be Rinsaiji temple where you'll have a chance to listen to the peaceful and relaxing chants of the monks and take a walk around the temple. After the visit, you will have a traditional lunch with fresh ingredients from Ishikawa prefecture. Then, you will have a walk around Shiramine area, where you will find all the important historical buildings. The traditional style of the buildings attracts people not only from overseas but also from Japan. You will have sufficient time to explore the area. Finally you will go back to Kanazawa city to visit Teramachi (temple town), home to about 70 temples, built closely together around the castle to protect it during the Edo period. Enjoy a visit to a couple of temples in Teramachi as well as the traditional atmosphere and peacefulness of the town.
strTitle: Visit shrines & taste sake in a tour of Kanazawa!

strIntroduction: This is a 1 day bus tour, that takes you to Shuri Castle, the Navy Underground Headquarters, the Himeyuri Monument, the Peace Memorial Park, Okinawa World and Gyokusendo Cave departing from Naha! Spend a whole day exploring beautiful Okinawa! The tour will pick-up you up at 9:00 from the designated hotels: Okinawa Miyako Hotel and Hotel Nikko Naha Grand or you can arrive at Naha bus office and check-in there for the tour. The bus will take you to Shuri Castle, designated as a UNESCO World Heritage Site in 2000. It was the home of the Ryukyu kings and the center of culture, politics and diplomacy of the Ryukyu Kingdom during 1429 - 1879. It features vivid red, yellow and blue colors that represent the traditional Okinawan culture. *Entrance to the interior of Shurijo castle is optional. The tour will then move on to the Former Japanese Navy Underground Headquarters; built in 1944, it is said that the headquarters was 450 meter long at that time, now 300 meter of the headquarters are open to the public, where you can see many interesting areas such as the operation room, the code room, the medical room, the chief commander's room, etc. It is a very important and significant place to learn about the history of Okinawa. You will then visit Himeyuri monument, and after the visit you will have an hour to enjoy a delicious lunch included in the tour. *Depending on your tour date, the location for lunch will differ. (Odd number days) Himeyuri Kaikan (Even number days) Yuubi-do Then, you will be able to relax in the amazing natural landscapes of the Peace Memorial Park, where you can see the 'Cornerstone of Peace' at the Peace Memorial Museum, a memorial inscribed with the names of 240,000 people fallen on both sides of World War II. *Entrance to the Peace Memorial Museum is optional. You will then be taken to the Gyokusendo Cave, visited by millions of tourists every year and known as the "most beautiful cave in Asia". This natural wonder is 5000 meter long and it is one of the biggest caves in Japan. It's located inside Okinawa World, a theme park where you can experience Okinawan culture by strolling through an Okinawan village or a tropical fruits garden, by watching the Habu (yellow spotted lance-head snake) show or an Okinawan dance, among many other activities. Drop-offs at following locations: -Okinawa Miyako Hotel -Hotel Nikko Naha Grand Castle. -Kokusai Dori Bus Stop -Naha Bus Terminal
strTitle: Explore south Okinawa's nature and history on a bus tour

strIntroduction: In this 1-day sightseeing bus tour, you will visit several popular sightseeing spots including the world's famous Churaumi Aquarium, the Butterfly garden, the Nago Pineapple Park, and the Glass Museum. The main attraction on this bus tour is Churaumi Aquarium. Churaumi literally means "beautiful ocean" in Okinawan dialect and features hundreds of marine species in huge, beautiful tanks where you will be abel to spot 8.6m long whale sharks, big manta rays, corals and deep-sea fish! You will spend about three hours at the aquarium, giving you plenty of time to explore it at your leisure. Located in front of the Churaumi Aquarium, you will head to the Ryugujo butterfly garden, where you can interact with butterflies, buy souvenirs and eat lunch at the observation deck where you can see the beautiful blue East China Sea. (lunch included in the tour) Next, you will head to the Nago Pineapple Park, where you can enjoy fun activities related to pineapples, buy souvenirs, and of course, eat some delicious pineapples. You can even ride a cart that will take you through the pineapple fields allowing you to take in amazing views. Finally, you will visit Mori no Glass, the Glass Museum, where you can watch how Ryukyu glassware takes shape in the hands of glassblowers and buy some for yourself, it will be a great souvenir from Okinawa. This tour is available everyday. Until September 30th, 2016, you can even a receive small gift at: -Butterfly garden -Nago Pineapple Park -Glass Museum in the Forest Itinerary: 07:50 - 10:25 Pick-up at following location - ANA InterContinental Manza Beach Resort - Hotel Hokke Club Naha Shintoshin - Hotel Monterey Okinawa Spa & Resort - Hotel Moon Beach - Laguna Garden Hotel - Loisir Hotel Naha - Nansei Kanko Hotel - Okinawa Kariyushi Urban Resort Naha - Okinawa Marriott Resort and Spa - Prefectural Building Square (Kenchomae Kenmin Hiroba) - Renaissance Resort Okinawa - Rizzan Sea Park Hotel Tancha Bay - Sun Marina Hotel - The Beach Tower Okinawa 11:20 Ryugujo (Butterfly Paradise) (-50 min) Enjoy your lunch here! 12:15 Churaumi Aquarium (-180 min) 15:40 Nago Pineapple Park (-30 min) 16:20 Mori no Glass (-20 min) 17::00-19:30 Drop-off at designated hotels
strTitle: Enjoy a 1-day Sightseeing Bus Tour of North Okinawa

strIntroduction: Japanese tea ceremony is a traditional art involving the ceremonial preparation and presentation of "matcha", high-quality powdered green tea. Around the end of the 12th century, the style of tea preparation, called "tencha" in which powdered matcha was placed into a bowl with hot water whisked together, was introduced to Japan by a monk on his way back from China. He also took tea seeds back with him, which eventually produced the tea considered to be of the highest quality in Japan. Tea preparation and presentation skills are passed down generation to generation. On this tour, guests can make tea from the powder and try traditional Japanese sweets that pair perfectly with the bitter green tea. After the tea ceremony, visitors will enjoy a musical performance on the shamishen, which is a Japanese guitar with three strings. A woman will sing with the shamishen and perform traditional Japanese dance. This cultural experience will last about an hour and if you would like to explore more traditional arts there are other plans available where you can try Japanese home cooking. Come out and enjoy these fun and unique cultural activities in Osaka!
strTitle: Learn Japanese Traditional Cultural Arts in Osaka!

strIntroduction: Cruising along the streets on two wheels it the best way to discover the ancient city of Kyoto. A bike tour tracking a scenic route bound for Higashiyama has been prepared for guests. Whether you are a seasoned veteran or a travel rookie, this will be a great way to explore one of the greatest cities in the world. Departure is at 8:45 and begins with cycling along the Kamo river, passing traditional machiya houses and traditional Japanese restaurants. There will then be a stop at Heian-Jungi Shrine. Built in 1895 We depart from 8:45 and cycle along the Kamo river while passing traditional machiya houses and traditional Japanese restaurants. Then, there will be a stop at the famous Heian-Jingu Shrine. Next, pedal along quaint canals on the way to Nanzenji, one of the most important Zen temples in Japan. Enjoy scenic surroundings of a brick aqueduct and the Higashiyama Mountains. Last we will head off down “Tetsugaku-no-Michi” or the Philosophers’ Path. Lined by hundreds of cherry trees, it is the most popular walking path for locals and tourists in Kyoto. Then, we head back to Kyoto Station and end the tour.
strTitle: Enjoy Half-Day Bike Tour in Higashiyama, Kyoto!

strIntroduction: The ancient art of Japanese flower arrangement, "ikebana" originated from the flowers that were presented in honor of Buddha at the altar. According to the establishment of Rokkakudo of Buddhist Temple in Kyoto, the style and rules have changed with the growing times and customs. At this lesson you can learn the basic arrangement of flowers and how to show off their natural beauty based on the Japanese aesthetics of simplicity. It is said that the difference between Japanese flower arrangement and that of western countries is in the simplicity. Japanese flower arrangement stems from religious philosophy that has been passed down through generations. Making the arrangement is like seeing the transitory life of the flower with appreciation of its natural beauty in mind. Japanese flower arrangement is not only popular among women, but also company and business leaders who learn it for the purpose of increasing their business sense, intuitive power, judgement, decision-making skills, creativity and insight. Explore the world of Japanese aesthetics in the same fashion as the pioneers of the art in the ancient world. Changing the combination of flowers and containers based on various forms of arrangement create beauty in reflection of the natural scenery. The arrangement is also a reflection of the arranger's nature and personality which can be expressed through this art. From the materials chosen to the final product, expressing yourself through this ancient art is a great way to learn about and appreciate Japanese culture!
strTitle: Learn Traditional Art of Japanese Flower Arrangement, Kyoto!

strIntroduction: Japanese calligraphy has its roots in ancient China. Through the writing of these complex characters, the Japanese have developed their own technique and writing style which has a strong decorative component. Calligraphy as artwork has a close relationship with the natural world, the temperament of people and the country's philosophies. Many believe that these elements are the key differences between Japanese and Chinese calligraphy. At the lesson, you can learn about the basics of Japanese calligraphy such as how to use the "fude" brush and black ink container, "suzuri". The challenging part is making the strokes in the correct order and moving the brush with just the right amount of pressure on the thin paper. At first glance, it may seem easy, but this art requires perfect concentration and timing in order to correctly write the next stroke. As you write, you may feel the spiritual state of nothingness that embodies Zen meditation. Many Japanese people thoroughly enjoy this feeling and believe it is vital to their self-development and emotional control. The aroma of the ink may help you relax and your writing position can help improve your posture. All of these factors contribute to the idea that calligraphy is good for one's personal health. Learning how to write calligraphy with passion, patience and creativity is great for people of all ages and makes a great souvenir. Write your own favorite words and take part in this unique cultural experience.
strTitle: Experience the Ancient Art of Japanese Calligraphy in Kyoto!

strIntroduction: This exciting afternoon tour allows visitors to take in some great sites of Sapporo City! Our two main stops will be Okurayama Ski Jump Stadium and Hitsujigaoka Observation Hill. Okurayama Ski Jump Stadium has hosted many famous winter athletic events including the 1972 Winter Olympics and the 2007 FIS Nordic World Ski Championships. Hitsujugaoka Observation Hill is a famous scenic spot in Sapporo that offers a panoramic view of the Ishikari Plain with Sapporo Dome in the foreground. Itinerary: - 13:55 - Check-in at Sapporo Station Bus Terminal - 14:10 - Departure - 14:45 - Visit Okurayama Ski Jump Stadium (1 hour) - 16:15 - Visit Hitsujigaoka Observation Hill (40 minutes) - 17:05 - Arrival at Fukuzumi Subway Station (Drop-off 1) - 17:30 - Arrival at Susukino (Drop-off 2) - 17:35 - Arrival at Sapporo Clock Tower (Drop-off 3) - 17:40 - Arrival at Sapporo Station Bus Terminal (Drop-off 4) Attention: 1. There are no seats for children under 6. If you want to book a seat for your child please book as 6-11. 2. The tour could be delayed depending on the traffic conditions. 3.The tour could be canceled depending on the weather. 4. The tour will pass Sapporo Dome, but will not stop for a visit. 5. Admission fees are not included. 6. Multilingual Audio Devices are available. 7. Ask staff for details concerning discounts
strTitle: See Famous Sites Around Sapporo City on an Afternoon Tour!

strIntroduction: This is a full-day tour that departs from the center of Sapporo. Embrace the beauty of nature at Yuni Garden and Northern Horse Park. Enjoy a buffet lunch which includes the most delicious melons in Japan! strTitle: Enjoy 1-Day Tour, Yuni Garden & Northern Horse Park, Sapporo

strIntroduction: You might not imagine that there are luxurious ryokan in Tokyo because of the noisy city and the lack of greenery but there is a good news, there are many gorgeous and elegant ryokan in Tokyo too! Many tourists go to Kyoto with a wish to experience traditional Japanese culture, but you can also enjoy that in Tokyo too by staying at a luxurious ryokan! If you stay at a ryokan in Tokyo you can not only enjoy it's noisy side but also it's quiet and comfortable side too! Located near the centre of the city, they are very convenient too! strIntroduction: What is one of the most exciting experiences in Kyoto? It's to stay at a luxurious ryokan! Kyoto is well-known as a historical district, where you can explore traditional Japanese buildings. If you stay at a luxurious ryokan in Kyoto, you can surely experience traditional Japanese culture, enjoy delicious Japanese cuisine, relax by taking a bath at an onsen (hot spring), and much more. Enjoy a night at a luxurious ryokan during your stay in Kyoto! --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- ※ Price Includes ※ This price includes our service fee. The price does not include the cost of your accommodation. You must pay for your accommodation fee at the ryokan.
