strIntroduction: Kaga city is located to the southwest of Kanazawa city in Ishikawa prefecture. It’s only three hours away from Tokyo and 2 and a half hours from Osaka or Nagoya. It's famous for the the four different Onsen (hot spring) located nearby. They are Awazu Onsen, Katayamazu Onsen, Yamashiro Onsen and Nakayama Onsen. This bus pass called “Can bus” has two different routes which cover the main attractions of the area. One route goes around the mountain side and the other one goes around the sea side and both routes start at Kaga Station. The bus stand is easy to find. It’s only about 30 meters away from the main entrance to the station. The bus will stop at all the sightseeing spots and you can get off and get on the bus anytime as long as there is a space and you show the bus ticket. There is a guide on board the bus, who will inform you about all the places you can visit. Since there a re so many interesting places to visit, you will have to plan ahead and choose the ones that you most want to visit. Some of these attractions are natural landscapes, art galleries, sweet shops, historical or science museums, etc. You will have many options available to enjoy the area to the fullest and according to your interests. Kaga city itself has over 1300 years of history that make it an interesting place to explore, and of course, don't forget to soak in the warm waters at any of the Onsen springs in this area.
strTitle: Explore Kaga Onsen with a 1 or 2-day bus pass in Ishikawa

strIntroduction: Odawara, Hakone, Yugawara, and Atami – these are the must-see great resorts near Tokyo! With many hot springs, museums, a castle park, flower gardens and Mt. Fuji viewing spots, there are countless activities for you to enjoy. This 2-days bus pass gives you a great chance to enjoy these sights at your convenience. For two days, you can ride on any bus as many times as you like throughout the entire area. The pass even includes the entrance fee for the Hakone-en Aquarium, rides on the Jikkoku Mountain Cable Car and a popular boat cruise on Lake Ashi! As a bonus, you can get discounts at various tourist facilities and restaurants! This will take away the stress of figuring out the right amount and carry spare change to pay for the buses and will make you save money! Just show your pass at the ticket counter, at the shop, or to the driver. Go anywhere you want and do whatever you like, with this pass you can make your own itinerary and have fun at the best resorts in Japan! This is a suggestion on how you can take the most out of your pass 09:20 Exchange Voucher at the Atami Station Bus Counter 10:00 Jikkoku-toge Entrance Reach the peak of Jikkoku mountain by cable car, where you will be able to view the port town of Izu, Suruga bay, Sagami bay, and even Tokyo Sky Tree on a clear day. 11:20 Hakone Sekisho Visit Hakone Ekiden Museum or Hakone Sekisho Checkpoint Museum (admission fees not included). You can have lunch at any of the nearby cafes and restaurants. Head for Moto-Hakone Port by boat. You can ride on the Lake Ashi (bus tour included with this pass) 13:10 Moto-Hakone Port Visit Hakone Shrine, a 10-minute walk from Moto-Hakone Port. Get on the boat again for Hakone-en. 14:45 Hakone-en The Hakone-en Aquarium features 450 species of aquatic animals (entrance fee to the aquarium is included in the pass). There is a ropeway that takes you to the summit of Mt. Komagatake, where you can enjoy a panoramic view of Mt.Fuji on a clear day. 17:00 End your day at Odawara Station The itinerary above is just an example. You are free to decide how to take the most out for your 2 days pass!
strTitle: 2-Days bus pass for Atami, Hakone, Odawara & Yugawara!

strIntroduction: We offer udon nootles cooking class at a local home in Kasugai city near Nagoya. Schedule: ・10:00 Meet at Kachigawa Station. It's only 18 minutes away from Nagoya Station (JR Chuo line). If you are worried about trains we will meet at Nagoya Station. (Japanese supermarket tour is available if you want) ・10:15 Creating origami chopstick rest (Japanese knife rest) with welcome tea. ・10:30 Taste Japanese condiments, cooking Japanese soup stock (dashi) from a bar of dried bonito and kelp. ・10:50 Cook homemade udon, a side dish or tempura and desserts. ・12:30 Eat with drinks ! ・13:30 Send off at Kachigawa Station About the cooking class: ・Duration: about 3-4 hours. ・Included: aprons, tasting Japanese condiments, learning tips and history about your dishes, creating origami chopstick rest, drinks, English recipe printed out, pictures. ・drinks: Maccha tea bowl, green tea, barley tea, coffee and tea. ・Minimum participants: 1 person. ・Max participants: 4 people. ・Languages: English, Japanese. ※If you would like to book for a date and time that are not on the list, mail us (Halal, Vegan, vegetarian menu are also available) ※Supermarket tour is also available. Please let me know if you would like to go.
strTitle: Make and Cook Homemade Udon near Nagoya

strIntroduction: “Utsue” Waterfalls This site is about 17 km away from Takayama Station, 30 mins by car. It is designated by the Japanese Government as one of the 100 most beautiful natural scenery in Japan. It is especially beautiful in autumn when leaves change their color. The area of 800 Ha is a natural park at 1,300 meters altitude. There is a viewpoint to see the Japan Alps at 880 meters altitude. There are almost 13 different waterfalls within 1 hour walking distance. Some of them are more than 15-meter heigh. The area has also beautiful a trekking course of 1.5 km. “Hana no Mori” Flower Park This flower park is located next to the Utsue Waterfall. It features a variety of Japanese flower blooming in different times of the year. It is only open from late-May to early-August. Among the highlights are 10,000 plants of “Bamboo Lily” in June-July, 150,000 plants of “Japanese Primrose” in May-June, 5,000 plants of “Hydrangea” in July-August. You can also see flowers such as “Asian Skunk Cabbage”, “Golden Lace”, “Sweet Flag”, “Japanese Stewartia” in the park. The tree species you can find in the park will be “Magnolia”, “Japanese white birch”, “Horse Chestnut”, “Japanese Cedar”, “Japanese Oak”, etc. “Yuyukan” Hot Spring (Onsen) This is a simple alkaline hot spring facility, located near the “Utsue” waterfalls. 6 types of indoor bath facilities and 3 types of open-air bath facilities are available. There is a waterfall shower (pelting water), stone sauna (good for anti-aging and smooth skin by intense perspiration), salt sauna (detoxing skin by salt), bubble & Jacuzzi bath, infrared sauna, etc. Complete experiences of Japanese “Onsen” is assured here.
strTitle: Enjoy Takayama's nature:13 waterfalls, flower park and onsen

strIntroduction: Shinto is the main religion believed and practiced widely by most of Japanese people, together with Buddhism. If you understand the basics of Shinto Shrine principles and practices, you will understand Japanese cultural context better. Hie-Shrine is located a bit far (20-25 mins walk) from Takayama Station, thus it is less visited by tourists. Without seeing the crowds of tourists, we can learn together and observe the Torii Gate, Shimenawa rope, donation, praying, purifying yourselves, Komainu liondogs, lanterns, fortune telling, etc. Zen temples are rather rare in Takayama, but we can pick one of the Zen temple in the northern part of town that offer Zen practice classes for any visitors. Finally, the Sukyo Mahikari Headquarter building is very visible from anywhere in Takayama, as it is huge and outstanding architecture that draws everyone's attention. We are dare enough to actually make a visit to the main hall of this newly developed religious sect's (new age type of religion) magnificent building. Pick-up at 9AM / 2PM Send off at 1PM / 6PM (4 hours tour)
strTitle: Experience Zen: Spiritual and meditating moments in Takayama

strIntroduction: Tea ceremony is one of interesting experiences that you can participate in during your visit in Takayama: to feel the old days Japanese samurai warriors' spiritual meditative practices. Festival floats are magnificently exhibited in Matsuri no Mori museum where you can observe wonderful decorations and craftsmanship of each float (or portable shrine). In this museum, we can watch the actual puppets performances (automated), actually practice the manipulation of puppets by your hands, and see the world largest flat Japanese drums (Taiko) performances. If you want to refresh in a hot spring onsen, we can stop at the high quality hot spring spa facility of the 5-star hotel Associa Takayama. If you still want to explore the traditional folk culture further on that day, we can make another stop at Hida folk village to observe traditional houses and gassho-style houses in this very popular open-air museum.
strTitle: Enjoy Japanese traditional cultural experiences in Takayama

strIntroduction: This museum is probably the most holistic, global, biggest and extensive museum among the 100 museums existing in Takayama, but because of its location, it is the least visited museum as well. It covers Western classic/contemporary arts, Japanese paintings, calligraphy, sculptures, performing arts, dinosaurs, ethnicity, costumes, Egyptian/Asian civilization, and a lot more to offer! As most of the exhibits have their instructions in English, and you can spend almost 2-3 hours to see all the works in detail, I can simply drop you at the museum, and pick you anytime convenient for you. So, it is a self-guided tour in the museum. I really recommend visiting this museum, especially when you have 2-3 hours to spare in Takayama, nothing else to do or you got bored with all the traditional places of the small town. This museum is very big!
strTitle: Visit the hidden gem HIKARU museum in Takayama

strIntroduction: We will take you deep into Tokyo by bicycle. You can go back and see the Edo period even Japanese people do not know these places very well. This tour goes around some historical places on east side of Tokyo. This area is old downtown area. The atmosphere of old Tokyo still remains. Yoshiwara is the place where young girls used to work as prostitute. Yoshiwara does not exsist as a town any more, but still you can see some remains. Sanya is the place that helped the high economic growth period of Japan and the location of the famous cartoon ‘’Tomorrow’s Joe’’. Do you know Shiki Masaoka?? He is a famous poet. Visit his house where spent his last years and get to know his unique personality. After sightseeing, take coffeebreak at a world famous coffee roastery. Have lunch at Uenosakuragiatari. This the little-known spot is a renovated traditional house which is now a modern shop. Course: CYT→Yoshiwara→Jokanji Temple→Namidabashi Bridge→Nihondutsumi→Ueno→Shikian→CYT Edit
strTitle: Cycle to Tokyo's past with a local neighbourhood ride

strIntroduction: In this tour, you can enjoy jaw-dropping night views from Mount Rokko! Since Mount Rokko can be reached by a complicated transportation route, it is very troublesome and difficult to get there on your own. Your English guide will be a big help to experience this unforgettable sightseeing tour! Don't miss this chance to see Rokkosan's night view, that is well-known as the "Million-dollar Nightscape"! You can choose either Shin-Kobe Station,where the Shinkansen bullet train stops, or Sannomiya Station, which is in the center of Kobe city, as your meeting point. (Hotel pick-up is also available as an additional-option for this tour). You can enjoy the Million-dollar Nightscape from the observatory, soon after you take the cable car from the foot of Mount Rokko. The night view from Rokkosan is unforgettable with its fascinating scenery! At Rokko Garden Terrace, you can not only see the beautiful night view but also eat a delicious dinner and enjoy shopping to buy some souvenirs to your family and friends! It is one of the most popular panorama observation spot in Japan, where you can see Akashi strait, Osaka plain, and Kansai International airport. The night view from the Rokko Garden Terrace is jaw-dropping, it's a must-visit tourist spot when you visit Kobe! There are several restaurants available for your dinner, such as: Granite Cafe, Rokko View Palace, and Jingisukan Palace. An especially recommended restaurant would be Rokko View Palace, where you can observe the fascinating night view while you enjoy your dinner! Enjoy this valuable tour with an English guide to upgrade your trip in Kobe! This tour is available everyday. Itinerary: Meeting Point 1: Shin-Kobe Station Meeting Point 2: Sannomiya Station (15 min train ride from Shin-Kobe Station) *You can choose Shin-Kobe Station or Sannomiya Station for your meeting point. *Hotel pick-up is also available for this tour. Get on the bus at Rokkodo Station and head to Rokko Cable Shita Station (30 min) Ride on the cable car to Rokko Sanjo Station (10 min) Enjoy the observation deck at Rokko Sanjo (20 min) Take the bus to Rokko Garden Terrace Station (10 min) See the beautiful night view, Enjoy your dinner & Buy souvenirs at Rokko Garden Terrace! (150 min) Get back to Rokkodo station by bus and cable car (40 min) Drop-off Point 1: Sannomiya Station Drop-off Point 2: Shin-Kobe Station The price only includes Guide Fee. In addition to the price, other fees might cost depending on your tour. Transportation Fee: Meeting & Drop-off point 1 [Sannomiya Station] (Adult Age 12 & over) 2260 JPY (Child:Age 6 -11) 1140 JPY Meeting & Drop-off point 2 [Shin-Kobe Station] (Adult Age 12 & over) 2680 JPY (Child:Age 6 -11) 1360 JPY
strTitle: Enjoy Rokkosan Night View Tour with English Guide in Kobe!

strIntroduction: Make a reservation for this wonderful half-day morning Fukuoka tour, which will take you around Fukuoka’s famous sightseeing spots! You will be visiting Ohori Park, which is the Central Park of Fukuoka. You can enjoy the splendid view of the natural beauty of the seasonal flowers that change annually. You can see new spring greenery and azaleas from spring to early summer, full-fledged foliage in summer, colored leaves in fall, and the green figures of pine trees in winter. After visiting Ohori Park, you will have two available choices to visit next: 1. Fukuoka Municipal Zoo, a popular zoo that exhibits the elephants, giraffes, rare gorillas and Arabian Oryx. A total of 130 species and 550 animals in total are kept here. 2. Fukuoka Municipal Botanical Garden, 10 hectare grounds feature about 2,600 species of plants and 190,000 specimen in total. The itinerary for this tour will be as follows: - 09:00 Depart from Hotel Nikko Fukuoka - 09:20 Depart from Hotel Okura Fukuoka - 09:25 Ohori Park (10 min) - 09:45 Ohori Park Japanese Garden (20 min) Fukuoka Castle (drive-by) Fukuoka Municipal Zoo or Fukuoka Municipal Botanical Gardens *The guide will ask your preference on the tour day. - 12:20 Drop-off at Tenjin (in front of the Bank of Japan) - 12:40 Drop off at Hakata Station (Chikushi Exit) Reservation is difficult to make, so we suggest you to use our reservation service to book with no hassles.
strTitle: Enjoy a Fukuoka Morning Tour With English Speaking Guide!

strIntroduction: Koiwai is a 7,400-acre farm located amid the scenic splendour at the base of Mt. Iwate. Famous for its dairy produce, Koiwai is a popular tourist destination, attracting around 750,000 visitors every year. Koiwai is also famous for its lush and expansive forest. In this guided tour (Japanese-speaking guide only), you will learn everything about the unique forestry methods at Koiwai and discover how people and nature co-exist. You'll feel the cool breeze as you ride through the forest on this nature adventure. Your friendly guide will also tell you all about the diverse wildlife that live there. The meeting and ending point for this tour is at pastoral Makiba Park with its many attractions. Price include admission, tractor ride, Japanese-speaking guide and fee. All major credit cards accepted. Children under 5 may participate free of charge if carried. • Add-on: Guided Kamimaru cattle barn admission - additional fee. Meeting and drop off point - Makiba Park. Short Course: 40 minutes Start times: 10:00; 13:00*; 14:00; and 15:00 daily (check in 10 mins beforehand) *weekends and holidays only Long Course: approx. 60 minutes meet 10:50, end 12:00 daily. Access: Free parking available for 30 large buses and 2,300 standard cars. Arrivals by bullet train (Tohoku or Akita) or train (Tanzawa line), transfer to Bus at Morioka Station, platform 10 bound for "Koiwai Farm Makiba Park", or take the bus from Koiwai Station.
strTitle: Explore a Hundred-Year-Old Koiwai Forest, in Iwate!

strIntroduction: Koiwai is a 7,400-acre farm located amid the scenic splendour at the base of Mt. Iwate. Famous for its dairy produce, Koiwai is a popular tourist destination, attracting around 750,000 visitors every year. Some of the farm buildings in the area, including silos and cowsheds, have been deemed National Tangible Cultural Properties. These buildings are just part of the lovely scenery at Koiwai and has been featured in a number of television dramas and feature films. On this guided bus tour (Japanese-speaking guide only), you will learn everything about Koiwai, explore dairy farms normally closed to the public, and see how the dairy products are made. When you enter the beautiful, expansive forest, your guide will tell you all about the diverse wildlife that live there. The meeting and ending point for this tour is at pastoral Makiba Park with its many attractions. Price includes admission, bus fare, Japanese-speaking guide, and fee. All major credit cards are accepted. • Add-on: Guided Kamimaru cattle barn admission - additional fee. Meeting and drop off point - Makiba Park. Duration: 70 minutes Start times: 09:30; 11:00; 13:00; and 14:30 daily (check in 10 mins beforehand) Access: Free parking available for 30 large buses and 2,300 standard cars. Arrivals by bullet train (Tohoku or Akita) or train (Tanzawa line), transfer to Bus at Morioka Station, platform 10 bound for "Koiwai Farm Makiba Park", or take the bus from Koiwai Station.
strTitle: Explore the Koiwai Farm and Forest by Bus, in Iwate!

strIntroduction: Enjoy this self-guided tour from Kumamoto by bus. In Nagasaki, you will stay at a comfortable, clean and modern Nagasaki Bus Terminal Hotel.The hotel is perfectly located to explore Chinatown, one of the largest in Japan. You'll be able to browse the fascinating shops and restaurants of this vibrant, colourful area. There are also classic shopping arcades of the historic Dejima area where you can find souvenirs to take home. The hotel also makes for a great base from which to explore this amazing city to your own personal agenda, pace, and interests. For example, this great budget package is equally ideal for experiencing the nightlife in Nagasaki, or viewing the city from the top of the hills. While in Nagasaki, you should also try the local noodle dishes: champon and sara udon! With so many cultural and gastronomic delights to offer, Nagasaki is a great place to visit. Of course, visitors to the city are always encouraged to visit the Nagasaki Peace Park to consider the futility of human conflicts, and the horror this has led to in the past. Far from being a depressing and unsettling experience, this permanent exhibition and memorial, and indeed the city of Nagasaki itself, is a testament to hope and renewal in a spirit of peace and harmony.
strTitle: Experience a Self-Guided Tour of Nagasaki, for Couples

strIntroduction: On this tour, you can fully enjoy Okinawa by visiting Churaumi Aquarium Ocean Expo Park, Okashi Goten, Nago Pineapple Park or Okinawa Fruit Land, Manza Cape, and Ryukyu Village! This is a must join tour if you'd like to see the depths of Okinawan culture and its famous tourist spots all in a day! Churaumi Aquarium Ocean Expo Park is one of the largest aquariums in the world! You can see 8.6 meter whale sharks and families of manta rays in the 22.5 meter wide water tank! You can also see the many corals that grew up in the aquarium for more than 10 years. Since Churaumi Aquarium uses tons of seawater, the living creatures grow up healthily and naturally. Okashi goten is a huge Okinawan sweet shop where you can buy popular sweets including Okinawa's famous purple yam tartlets. With its smooth texture and the great aroma of the purple yam it has became one of the best souvenirs from Okinawa! In addition, you can buy various sweets such as; Chinsuko (a small biscuit made of mostly lard and flour), which is also one of the most loved traditional Okinawan sweets, Princess Moon (a cake with mango and citrus depressa), Shisa (a traditional Ryukuan decoration) shaped jellies, and more. You can buy your souvenirs and have your lunch at Okashi goten. Nago Pineapple Park is a theme park on the theme of pineapples where you can taste many kinds of pineapples and take a cart ride through the pineapple fields and even learn about harvesting pineapples! Okinawa Fruit Land is a tropical theme park where you can see various fruits, butterflies and birds and you can take a rest at fruit cafe, and also explore different kinds of themed zones. You can definitely have fun at these parks! *You will visit Nago Pineapple Park on even number days, and Okinawa fruit Land on odd number days. At Manza Cape, you can take a jaw-dropping photo of the beautiful ocean! The view from Manza Cape is fascinating and you can see a famous elephant-shaped rock. With its beautiful scenery and the clear ocean, it's one of the best tourist spots in Okinawa. Ryukyu Mura (Village) is a place where you can step back in time to see what life used to be like in the Ryuku Kingdom (1429 - 1879). Explore traditional buildings, watch Okinawan dance and listen to the traditional songs in Okinawa! This tour is available everyday from April 1st. Itinerary: *You can choose either Pick-up or Check-in for the meeting place. 08:50 (Check-in) Naha Bus Temporary Office 09:00 (Pick-up) Okinawa Miyako Hotel / Hotel Nikko Naha Grand Castle 10:50 Visit Churaumi Aquarium Ocean Expo Park (120 min) 13:15 Take lunch at Okashi goten (50 min) (Even number Days) Visit Nago Pineapple Park (50 min) (Odd number Days) Visit Okinawa Fruits Land (50 min) 15:45 Enjoy Manza Cape (20 min) 16:20 Enjoy Ryukyu Mura (60 min) Drop-offs at the following locations: Okinawa Miyako Hotel Hotel Nikko Naha Grand Castle Kokusai Street Bus Stops This tour ends at Naha Bus Terminal. Please get to the next destination on your own.
strTitle: Enjoy 5 Great Attractions in a bus tour from Naha, Okinawa

strIntroduction: This 1-Day tour explores the tropical Islands of Okinawa on a comfortable sightseeing bus, stopping by its main highlights and taking in its perfect landscapes! Starting at Palette Kumoji and continuing to Kouri Island where there is a 2 kilometer-bridge extending out to the middle of the glittering sea, you can stroll along to the Kouri Island and gaze at the outstanding ocean view! Then there is 150 minutes of free time at the Tropical Dream Center where you can discover the wildlife of the island close up as you explore the jungle filled with over 2,000 orchids and other colorful flowers! Here you can also choose some local lunch at the restaurant inside the Ocean Expo Center. If you have time, you can take a walk or trolley to the world class Churaumi Aquarium. The next stop is Yanbaru Ikoi no Mori Rest House where you can take a little break and treat yourself to an Okinawan dessert! Here you can pick up some souvenirs as well. The last stop is Ryukyu Village where you will learn about the ancient Ryukyu Okinawan culture while listening to its traditional music. There are daily performances of dances, charming Ryukyu houses to explore, and you can even have a chance to see a habu snake! It will be a fascinating and unforgettable experience!! Please note that this tour is mainly run for Japanese visitors, so there is only basic English assistance on the tour. Also if less than 2 participants are booked, the activity may be canceled.
strTitle: Explore Kouri Island and Ryukyu Village in Okinawa!

strIntroduction: Would you like to explore other places besides Tokyo? Are you looking for a tour with a unique experience? If so, then this 2-day tour will be great for you. This tour with an English-speaking guide offers you a fantastic experience by visiting Nihondaira, Kuno-zan Toshogu shrine, Mt. Fuji and more. In addition, you'll have the unique opportunity to ride the Tokaido Shinkansen and bathe in hot springs. The tour starts with an exciting train ride on the Tokaido Shinkansen which connects Tokyo and Shizuoka in just an hour and a half, so you can relax and enjoy your ride. In Nihondaira you can enjoy a 1,065 meter-long ropeway ride to Kuno-zan Toshogu shrine where you'll adore the breathtaking scenery of flowers, trees and Suruga Bay. Kuno-zan Toshogu shrine is a designated National Treasure and is dedicated to Ieyasu Tokugawa, a general in the Edo period. The shrine is built in the Gongen-zukuri style which is a famous architectural style in the Edo period. The extraordinary sculptures of the shrine are must-sees. The Nihondaira Ocha Kaikan (green tea hall) offers you a great chance at to taste green tea and you can't miss the wonderful landscape of Mt. Fuji, Suruga Bay and the green tea fields. Enjoying freshly made sushi lunch is a special bonus of this tour where the lively fish have been caught in Suruga Bay and directly brought to the restaurant. After the delicious lunch experience Japanese art from the Edo period at Shizuoka City Tokaido Hiroshige Museum of Art. It's a great opportunity to appreciate the works of Hiroshige Utagawa, the last master of Ukiyo-e ( woodblock prints). The highlight of the tour is undoubtedly the stop at the 2nd station of Mt. Fuji where you can appreciate its World Heritage! Your hotel stay at Hotel New Akao will also be vibrant and is located by the waterfront, offering you a Japanese style room with an ocean view. Here you can relax and soak yourself in an open-air hot spring bath. After a sufficient sleep, you will have unguided free time on Day 2 before boarding the Tokaido Shinkansen back to Tokyo on your own and the conclusion of your exciting tour experience. Here is the itinerary. Day 1 8:20 am Check-in at the JP Tower, B1, Tokyo Station Marunouchi South Exit 8:56 am - 9:03 am Depart from Tokyo station. Enjoy the Tokaido Shinkansen ride in the non-reserved section for a hour and half. 10:30 am Shizuoka station The tour will take you sightseeing by a tour bus. Nihondaira Ropeway (5 minutes) Kuno-zan Toshogu shrine (30 minutes) Nihondaira Ropeway (5 minutes) Nihondaira Ocha Kaikan (20 minutes) Lunch time in Shimizu (50 minutes) Shizuoka City Tokaido Hiroshige Museum of Art (30 minutes) ---A guided tour is offered in the museum. Mt. Fuji 2nd Station (15 minutes) 16:50 pm Mishima station The tour guide will attend until arrival at Mishima station but will not attend after this point. Please take the Kodama Shinkansen to Atami station on your own. Please go to Hotel New Akao from Atami station on your own. Hotel check-in. Enjoy the fantastic view from your ocean -view room. Experience the natural hot springs for your relaxation. Day 2 You have unguided free time on your own. Plan ahead and make the most of your time! 17:00 pm Please head to Atami station and board the Kodama shinkansen to Tokyo in the non-reserved section. 18:00 - 19:40 pm The tour ends at Tokyo station. The tour is available on Sunday, Tuesday, Wednesday, Thursday and Friday for the duration of 2 days. --Note-- ・If the participants are less than 2 people, the tour may be canceled. ・The tour goes up to the 2nd station of Mt. Fuji. The tour will not be canceled and refunds will not be arranged in times of poor visibility. ・Depending on the road conditions and the operating situation of the Shinkansen, some of the itineraries may be omitted. It doesn't cause the tour cancellation or refunds. ・If the tour is not able to reach the 2nd station of Mt. Fuji due to the weather and road condition, the tour may visit alternative destinations. ・Please be prepared for the cooler condition at the 2nd station of Mt. Fuji. It's estimated to be 5-10 degrees Celsius cooler than Tokyo. ・If Nihondaira Ropeway is not operated due to the weather condition or maintenance, alternative destinations will be provided. It doesn't cause the tour cancellation or the refunds. ・Please wear comfortable shoes for the 100 steps at Kuno-zan Toshogu shrine. ・Depending on the number of participants, the size of the tour bus may vary. ・A 500 JPY fee for the Nihondaira Ropeway fare will be applied to children of 4 and 5 years of age. ・Please kindly make a request for vegetarian meals or meals without raw fish upon your reservation of the tour. ・No refunds will be made for ticket charges for participants who have a JR Rail Pass. ・Hotel Information: Hotel New Akao Check-out time: 11 am
strTitle: 2-Day Mt. Fuji & Hot Springs Tour of Shizuoka from Tokyo!

strIntroduction: If you are exploring the Tokaido area or hold a JR Rail Pass, this tour is for you! This tour is with an English-speaking guide and offers you a full day of fantastic experiences by visiting Nihondaira, Kuno-zan Toshogu shrine, Mt. Fuji and more, so you'll be an expert of the Tokaido area after this tour. First the tour heads to Nihondaira where you can enjoy a 1,065 meter-long ropeway ride to Kuno-zan Toshogu shrine. From the ropeway window you'll see beautiful scenery with seasonal flowers and trees and Suruga Bay. It's amusing to see the Izu Peninsula when the sky is clear. After the ropeway ride a National Treasure awaits in Kuno-zan Toshogu shrine which is dedicated to Ieyasu Tokugawa, a general of the Edo period. The shrine was built in the Gongen-zukuri style which is a famous architectural style in the Edo period. The extraordinary sculptures of the shrine are must-sees. Nihondaira Ocha Kaikan (green tea hall) offers you green tea tasting and you can't miss the wonderful landscape of Mt. Fuji, Suruga Bay and green tea fields. Enjoying freshly made sushi lunch is a special bonus of this tour where the lively fish have been caught in Suruga Bay and directly brought to the restaurant. After experiencing Japanese art in the Edo period at Shizuoka City Tokaido Hiroshige Museum of Art there is the highlight of the tour, Mt. Fuji. The tour bus will take you to the 2nd station of Mt. Fuji so that you can appreciate the World Heritage Mountain! This tour will surely be the highlight of your trip to Japan and create precious memories for you. Here is the itinerary. 10:20 am Meet at Shizuoka Station Shinkansen Ticket Gate Nihondaira Ropeway (5 minutes) Kuno-zan Toshogu shrine (30 minutes) Nihondaira Ropeway (5 minutes) Nihondaira Ocha Kaikan (20 minutes) Lunch time in Shimizu (50 minutes) Shizuoka City Tokaido Hiroshige Museum of Art (30 minutes) ---A guided tour is offered in the museum. Mt. Fuji 2nd Station (15 minutes) 17:00-18:30 Disperse at Mishima station The tour is available on Sunday, Tuesday, Wednesday, Thursday and Friday with the duration of 7 - 8.5 hours. --Note-- ・If the participants are less than 2 people, the tour may be canceled. ・The tour goes up to the 2nd station of Mt. Fuji. The tour will not be canceled and refunds will not be arranged in times of poor visibility. ・Depending on the road conditions and the operating situation of the Shinkansen, some of the itineraries may be omitted. It doesn't cause the tour cancellation or refunds. ・If the tour is not able to reach the 2nd station of Mt. Fuji due to the weather and road condition, the tour may visit alternative destinations. ・Please be prepared for the cooler condition at the 2nd station of Mt. Fuji. It's estimated to be 5-10 degrees celsius cooler than Tokyo. ・If Nihondaira Ropeway is not operated due to the weather condition or maintenance, alternative destinations will be provided. It doesn't cause the tour cancellation or the refunds. ・Please wear comfortable shoes for the 100 steps at Kuno-zan Toshogu shrine. ・Depending on the number of participants, the size of the tour bus may vary. ・A 500 JPY fee for the Nihondaira Ropeway fare will be applied to children of 4 and 5 years of age. ・Please kindly make a request for vegetarian meals or meals without raw fish upon your reservation of the tour.
strTitle: One Day Tour to Kuno-zan Shrine and Mt. Fuji from Shizuoka!

strIntroduction: Located just to the south of Tokyo, Kamakura is one of the most popular tourist destinations in Japan. The city is known for being the political capital pf Japan 8 centuries ago when Minamoto no Yoritomo established a military center there. Under a government upheld by samurai, a warrior culture flourished there that was very different from the aristocratic culture in Kyoto. You will see a simpleness and dynamism in its architectures and Buddhist images. We will show you around temples and shrines in Kamakura that date back to the days of old. ●Tour Itinerary -10:45 Meet at Enoden Kamakura Information Desk -11:00 Depart from Kamakura Station -11:00 Kenchoji Temple A Zen Temple started by Hojo Tokiyori, the 5th regent of the Kamakura Shogunate, it is famous for its main gate, “Sanmon” and a big temple bell, “bonsho”. -11:45 Tsurugaoka Hachimangu Shrine This shrine has been standing here since the 12 century in honor of the ancestors of Minamoto Yoritomo who established Kamakura as a military center of Japan. You may even have a chance to see a traditional wedding ceremony here. -12:30 Kamakuragu Shrine This Shinto Temple is dedicated to a tragic prince, “Morinaga-Shinno,” who was made a captive in a small cave for nine months before being executed. A shrine still exits in the cave. -Lunch Time Participants who booked the Lunch Plan will have a Deluxe Boxed Lunch at a traditional Japanese restaurant, Miyokawa,. Participants who chose the Without Lunch Plan will be dropped off at Kamakura Station, and picked up 60 minutes later. -14:45 Hasedera Temple Known as the Temple of the Flowers, Hasedera houses a big Buddhist statue of an eleven headed Kannon, the goddess of Mercy. It is believed to have been made around the 8th century. -14:55 Kotokuin Temple and the Great Buddha This temple is famous for its magnificent Daibutsu (Great Buddha) which rises 18m high, towering above the ground below. -Tour ends at Kamakura Station Attention: *About the One Day Plan Without Lunch You will have 60 minutes to have lunch once you have been dropped off at Kamakura Station. You will then meet up again with the group at the same location. Please make sure you are not late to meet the bus. If you would like to add the Lunch to your tour please tell the tour guide or check-in staff before the tour departs. Once the tour starts we will not be able to accept your order. Lunch will cost an additional 1500 JPY per person.
strTitle: Hop on a Bus for a Half Day Tour of Kamakura’s Best Sights!

strIntroduction: In this tour, you will be able to explore two of the beautiful islands of Okinawa, Kohama Island and Taketomi Island where you can relax and have lunch in a resort or stroll around in the afternoon. You can either meet at Ishigaki Port or use a pick-up service at hotels. The first stop on the tour is Kohama Island where you will ride a bus and cut through the roads surrounded by sugarcane farms while visiting locations from the Japanese TV drama, “Churasan”. You will also go to Kubazaki shore to see the neighboring Nishiomote and Yubu Islands. You will be amazed by its beautiful beach and ocean. If you choose the morning plan, you will have lunch at Haimurubushi Resort which is one of the highest ranked hotels on Kohama Island, with a 4.7 customer rating out of 5 points. Then you will go to Taketomi Island where you will experience a water buffalo ride. You can sit back and enjoy the ride and enjoy the island breeze while listening to traditional Okinawan folk songs. Then you'll return to Ishigaki Island where the tour ends at Ishigaki Port or at drop-off Hotels. More information about the morning plan *You can enjoy free-time 1.5 to 3 hours at the resort hotel, Haimurubushi. You can use the shower at the pool or beach during the summer. Also you can borrow a bath towel. *You can select a departure time from below: 1. Leave Ishigaki port at 9:40 and return to Ishigaki port at 17:10 2. Leave Ishigaki port at 11:10 and return to Ishigaki port at 17:10
strTitle: Explore the Beautiful Islands of Taketomi and Kohama!

strIntroduction: Founded in the early 8th century, Nara was Japan’s old capital, predating even Kyoto. On this tour, you will see many historic architectures and national treasures which reveal how Japan’s culture has been incorporated from the influences of other countries. ●Tour Itinerary -Todaiji Temple The symbol of Nara, famous for the world’s largest wooden buildings within which sits the Great Buddha. -Kasuga Taisha Shrine This ancient shrine, built in the 8th century, is known for its hundreds of metal lanterns and large sacred cedar tree which is believed to be 1000 years old! -Kofukuji Treasure House After visiting Kofukuji Temple, the tour takes you to the Treasure House in which various Buddhist works of art, from the Asuka to Edo periods, are exhibited. Above all, the six-armed image of Ashura is a masterpiece! The tour ends here. Feel free to check the exhibits at your own pace. *Please understand that due to the 60th ceremonial reconstruction after 20 years, the itinerary for Kasuga Taisha may differ from the original tour due to area closures.
strTitle: Half Day Bus Tour for Nara's Top Three World Heritage Sites

strIntroduction: There is a huge cat boom in Japan right now with more and more cat restaurants opening. At “Café Cat Emon” you can enjoy tea time and cute cat items. Although there aren't any real cats, there are cat goods and dolls everywhere in the café and the dishes served here are all shaped or painted like cats. One unique thing about this café is that you can paint your own cat figure “Manekineko”. In English “Manekineko” is a beckoning cat and is an ornament which is usually made out of clay and in Japan it is often found in restaurants and shops as it is believed to draw visitors and customers. In addition you can enjoy the lunch menu of desserts and drinks where the all-time favorite is a Mont-Blanc cake with a cute cat face on it. As a souvenir, how about cat shaped cookies? In this Japanese style café, you can relax and enjoy cats to your hearts’ content!! Café Cat Emon is open every day except Mondays from 11:00 to 19:00 and is just 6 minutes-walk from Sendagi Station out of exit number 1.
strTitle: Color a Cat Figure with Coffee and Cookies in Tokyo!

strIntroduction: Choose between a convenient morning or afternoon tour of Ishigaki Island, visiting sights like the turquoise Kabira Bay, the dragon-festooned Toujin Grave and the lush Yaeyamayashi palm tree forest. On the morning tour, stop for lunch overlooking the ocean, and sample Yaeyama-style cuisine. Ideal for guests who cannot drive, this is a hassle-free way to tour Ishigaki. The bus guides sing traditional Okinawan songs while accompanying themselves on the sanshin (a three-stringed banjo). As the morning tour stops at the airport, this is a great way to see more of Ishigaki before your flight! Course A: Morning Tour Accompanied by one of the island's famous local guides (and his sanshin), spend your morning visiting the main sights of Ishigaki. A lunch of Yaeyama-style dishes at a restaurant with great views is included. * Due to shifts and vacations, the local morning guide may not be available. The following will be the schedule: 09:00-09:40 Meet at Azuma Bus Terminal/Pick-up at your hotel. * Pick-up at the following hotels are free. Please inform us of your hotel beforehand. Guests picked up at Royal Marine Palace, Granvrio Hotel, Beach Hotel Sunshine or Fusaki Resort Village will miss seeing Tourinji Temple. ANA Intercontinental Ishigaki Resort at 9:00 Hotel Nikko Yaeyama at 9:10 Beach Hotel Sunshine at 9:40 Fusaki Resort Village at 9:40 Hotel Royal Marine Palace at 9:40 Ishigaki Resort Grandvrio at 9:40 Azuma Bus Terminal at 9:15 Tourinji Temple and Gongendo Shrine (from bus) Toujin Grave (10 min) Nagura Bay Pass by this bay, where the sea and mangroves meet (from bus) Kabira Park (40 min) The turquoise water of this beautiful bay is justly famous. You can take a glass-bottom boat ride to see the vibrant marine life! Yamabare Farm and lunch at Aunt Poza's Restaurant (40 min) Enjoy a meal of Yaeyama cuisine overlooking the sea. Komehara Palm Forest (20 min) Tamatorizaki Viewpoint (15 min) Smell the hibiscus on the wind, while overlooking the ocean and Ishigaki's coral reefs. 13:40 Drop-off at Ishigaki Airport Miyaragawa Mangroves (from bus) 14:00 Tour ends at Azuma Bus Terminal Course B: Afternoon Tour Accompanied by a female guide, join this afternoon tour enlivened by local island songs. A snack break is included. The following will be the schedule: 13:30-14:15 Meet at Azuma Bus Terminal/Pick-up at your hotel. * Pick-up at the following hotels is free. Please inform us of your hotel beforehand. ANA Intercontinental Ishigaki Resort at 13:30 Hotel Nikko Yaeyama at 13:40 Beach Hotel Sunshine at 14:10 Fusaki Resort Village at 14:15 Hotel Royal Marine Palace at 14:10 Ishigaki Resort Grandvrio at 14:10 Azuma Bus Terminal at 13:45 Tourinji Temple (from bus) Toujin Grave (10 min) Kabira Park (40 min) The turquoise water of this beautiful bay is justly famous. You can take a glass-bottom boat ride to see the vibrant marine life! Light snack at Yamabare Farm Komehara Palm Forest (20 min) Sokohara Dam (from bus) 17:50 Tour ends at Azuma Bus Terminal The following conditions will apply: * The activity schedule is subject to change or cancellation due to weather or traffic conditions. * Children 5 and under can join the tour for free when accompanied by an adult (1 child per adult). However, a seat and meal are not provided. Should you wish to reserve a seat or meal, please pay the Child's fee * Please select where you wish to board (hotel or bus terminal) when booking this activity. * At the bus terminal, please exchange your voucher for a ticket. * If you are picked up at the ANA Intercontinental or Hotel Nikko, please tell the driver your name, and then exchange the voucher for a ticket when you arrive at the bus terminal. * If you are picked up at the Royal Marine Palace Hotel, Grandvrio Hotel, Sunshine Hotel or Fusaki Resort, please give your voucher to the guide. * The tour itself will be conducted in Japanese, but the guide may speak very basic English. * If disabled guests show their "Disability Card" at the desk, their fee will be discounted to the Child's fee.
strTitle: Venture Out on Half-Day Island Tour of Ishigaki, Okinawa!

strIntroduction: From the turquoise Kabira Bay (with optional glass-bottom boat tour) to the Tamatori Viewpoint, enjoy Ishigaki's beautiful natural sights. In the afternoon, we'll visit Taketomi Island, taking in the red-roofed Ryukyu village from one of the famous water buffalo carts. Lunch at Aunt Pozu's restaurant is included. This hassle-free tour makes exploring the islands easy! The following will be the schedule: 08:50-09:30 Meet at Ishigaki Port/Pick-up at your hotel * The pick-up (and drop-off) at the following hotels is free. Please inform us of your hotel beforehand. Fusaki Resort Village at 8:50 Beach Hotel Sunshine at 8:55 Ishigaki Resort Grandvrio at 9:00 Hotel Royal Marine Palace at 9:02 Hotel Nikko Yaeyama at 9:15 Okinawa EXES Ishigakijima at 9:00 ANA Intercontinental Ishigaki Resort at 9:15 Hotel Best Inn Ishigakijima at 9:17 Arrive at Ishigaki Port Terminal at 9:30 09:30 Tour Starts Bus tour of Ishigaki Tourinji Temple (from bus) Toujin Grave Kabira Park (optional discounted glass-bottom boat tours) Lunch at Aunt Poza's Restaurant Bus Tour of Ishigaki Komehara Palm Forest Tamatorizaki Viewpoint Miyaragawa mangroves 14:45 Departure from Ishigaki Port Tour of Taketomi Water buffalo cart tour (with singing driver!) Departure from Taketomi Port Please choose between a 16:00, 17:00 or 17:40 return. Tour ends at Ishigaki Port/Drop-off at hotels The following conditions will apply: * The activity schedule is subject to change or cancellation due to weather or traffic conditions. * This tour is operated only in Japanese. * In case of rain, the tour will go ahead as scheduled. Please make sure to bring rain gear. * If you wish to ride the glass-bottom boat at Kabira Bay, payment will occur on location. * There will not be a guide on the boat to Taketomi, but a guide will be waiting for you on the island. * The tour will not run during Taketomi Island's Tanadui Festival in November.
strTitle: Enjoy A Full-Day Island Tour of Ishigaki and Taketomi!

strIntroduction: From Nagoya Station, it takes about 50 minutes by Kodama bullet train to arrive at Kyoto. You don’t have to overly prepare for this trip. Instead, pack light so you can have room for your souvenirs! Once you have arrived at Kyoto Station, you will meet the rest of the tour group members. An English-speaking guide will accompany the tour during sightseeing in the city of Kyoto. The first stop is Nijo Castle, which is a world heritage site. The interiors, architectural design and some buildings are national treasures and important cultural properties. Take your time to look around and enjoy the view of the garden. The next stop is Kinkakuji Temple. This gorgeous zen temple is completely covered in gold leaf and surrounded by one of the most exquisite Muromachi period gardens in Kyoto. Don’t forget to take photos of this shiny temple. There are also natural springs, water falls, and unique stones that make it interesting. The last stop is Kyoto Imperial Palace, which was the residence of the Emperor of Japan until 1869. The buildings are surrounded by Kyoto Gyoen national garden where you can see beautiful flowers and plants throughout the year. After visiting the spots above, the bus will return to Kyoto Station. You will have free time until your departure. There are so many things to see, eat and shop around Kyoto station. Don’t forget to schedule your time wisely and not to run out the time! Duration: 15.5 - 16.5 hour(s) Available: Daily
strTitle: Book a 1-Day Tour to Kyoto via the Bullet Train from Nagoya

strIntroduction: In this full day bus tour, we'll head to the neighborhood of Asuka Village, where the imperial palace and capital were founded from the 6th to the early 8th century. This is called the Asuka period when Buddhism was introduced from Baekje of Korea, and Buddhist culture started to flourish in Japan. While worshipping the Shinto gods, people began to take in Buddhism. We'll stroll through Asuka village, which had an important part of culture and politics for the nation. ●Tour Itinerary >Start from JR Nara Station (at 9:10), or Kintetsu Nara Station (9:15) *Check in at bus information center by 20 minutes before the bus departure time >Omiwa Shrine Visit the Omiwa Shrine deifying Mount Miwa. It is believed that a white snake lives around the shrine, which are one of the gods. People make an offering of egg under a sacred tree and the gigantic torii gate welcomes you in front of the shrine. >Ishibutai Kofun Tomb Visit the colossal ancient burial mound that has the largest horizontal stone chamber in Japan. The tomb is believed to be the grave of Soga no Umako, one of the associates of Prince Shotoku. >Lunch (not included in Tour Price) You will have about 50-minutes of lunch time after your visit Ishibutai Kofun Tomb. There are restaurants such as Asukano or Dream City Chaya near by. >Asuka Temple Japan's oldest Buddhist temple, which is said to be built by the orders of Soga no Umako. >Tachibana Temple This location is said to be the birthplace of a legendary regent, Prince Shotoku. >Tour End Points Kintetsu Nara (Arrive at 16:15) JR Nara Station (Arrive at 16:20)
strTitle: Visit Japan's First Shrine & Temple via a Bus Tour, in Nara

strIntroduction: Okinawa cuisine has two different cultural histories. One is called Ryukyu style cuisine that has the original roots and influence of China, which had been served for treating state guests from China since old age in the Ryukyu Kingdom, The second one is called Okinawa cuisine, which has its influence from the US and other countries, after the world war. At this private cooking class, you can learn about Ryukyu style cuisine, improve your knowledge of the Okinawa's food history and culture by visiting a local market and seeing the authentic materials. It'll then be selected and purchased. Enjoy the experience as if you're living in Okinawa, simply by shopping at a local food market. Through this experience, you can get a glimpse into people's daily life in Okinawa, not only the food history and culture. The schedule of this experience will be carried as follows: 10:00 or 16:00 Meeting at Bunka Tenbusu building in Naha city. Head to the local market on foot. (About 3 minutes) Walk around the market, along with an explanation of the area. (About 20 minutes) Get a brief explanation about local food material with the information of Okinawa's food culture and traditional Okinawa. (About 20 minutes) Get advice on selecting the material and purchasing if you'd like. After shopping, we'll go to the school by car. (About 5 minutes) Experience the cooking practice of Okinawa and its specialty. (About 1.5 - 2 hours ) Enjoy your meal (About 30- 40 minutes) End of the class. Okinawa cuisine is popular among woman as a healthy food that has a beauty effect and longevity effect. Okinawa cuisine is made with various ingredients such as pork, tofu, beans, seasonal vegetable, and fresh seafood. After you've learned about Okinawa cuisine, you can try to reproduce the dishes of Ryukyu style food at your home country, Explore the new aspect of Japanese local cuisine from this cooking class!
strTitle: Learn to Cook Traditional Food From Okinawa in Naha

strIntroduction: Nara has a history of being Japan’s first permanent capital. Heijokyo. Heijokyo was founded in the 8th century. There are a number of temples, shrines, and historical monuments in the old capital and tremendous beauties are still preserved here. We'll take you by bus and walk to the most important places that established the art and culture in Nara. ●Tour Itinerary >Departure from JR Nara Station (9:55) or Kintetsu Nara Station (10:00) *Check in at the sightseeing bus information center by 20 min before departure >Horyuji Temple Known as the world's oldest wooden structure, the temple houses 45 national treasures and many other important cultural assets, such as Buddhist paintings. We will visit the Golden Hall, the Five-Storied Pagoda, and the Hall of Dreams. >Chuguji Temple Founded by Prince Shotoku, a regent of the Asuka Period, the temple's principal object of worship is a bust of the graceful Miroku Bosatsu (Buddha of the Future) in a seated pose. >Lunch (30 min) If you like to try a special lunch box, please order at the information center on the tour day. (Additional fee applies) >Jikoin Temple Zen temple built by Katagiri Sasamasa to pray for the happiness of his father’s soul. Katagiri Sasamasa is the founder of the Sekishu style of tea ceremony. We will enjoy the view of the Japanese garden over a cup of matcha green tea! >Yakushiji Temple Constructed by Emperor Tenmu in the late 7th century for the recovery of his sick wife, Yakushiji is one of the oldest temples in Japan. Please note that the Eastern tower will be under construction and will not be part of the tour. >Toshodaiji Temple Founded by the famous Chinese priest, Ganjin, to train monks and to improve Japanese Budhism. The main hall, "Kondo" symbolizes a structure of the Nara Period. >Suzakumon Gate (view from bus) Nara became Japan's capital in 710, called "Heijokyo". The remains of Heijokyo has been preserved, and the Suzakumon Gate (1998) and Daigokuden Hall (2010) were beautifully restored. >Drop Offs JR Nara Station (around 16:55) or Kintetsu Nara Station (around 17:00) >Tour Ends (7 Hours) *Please note that tour prices will vary according to the viewing period of the Genjosanzoin-Garan in Yakushiji. Genjosanzoin-Garan Open Period: 2016 April 1 - June 30, Aug 13-15, Sept 16 - Nov 30 2017 Jan 1 - 15, March 1 - 31 Closing Period: 2016 July 1 - Aug 12, Aug 16 - Sept 15, Dec 1 - 31 2017 Jan 16 - Feb 28
strTitle: Venture on a Temple & Village 1-Day Bus Tour, in Nara

strIntroduction: Before transferring to Kyoto, the capital of Japan was founded in Nara. It was a time when the arrival of Buddhism had huge influences on culture, art, and architecture in Japan. In this tour, we'll visit ancient temples in Nara to learn how Buddhism began to take root in Japanese life. And we drop by “Suzaku-mon”, the restored front gate of Heijokyo Palace. ●Tour Itinerary >Start from JR Nara Station (at 13:55), or Kintetsu Nara Station (14:00). *Check in at the bus information center by 20 minutes before the bus departs. > Toshodaiji Temple Registered as UNESCO World Heritage Site, the temple was founded by Chinese monk, Jianzhen from the Tang Dynasty. The Golden Hall is a classical architecture of a single story. >Yakushiji Temple Founded by Emperor Temmu to pray for the recovery of his Empress from a serious illness. See a famous five-story pagoda and the Buddhist images on the national treasure list. Several times a year, Genjo-Sanzoin-Garan is open, which deifies a famous monk, Genjo Sanzo whose journey to India was fictionalized into a novel, “Saiyu-ki” or “Journey to the West”. > Suzakumon Gate Visit beautifully restored Suzakumon Gate on the remains of the Heijokyo Site. >Tour End Points 16:55 Arrive at JR Nara Station 17:00 Arrive at Kintetsu Nara Station at 17:00 *Please note that tour prices will vary according to the open period or closing period of the Yakushiji Genjo-Sanzoin temple. Genjo-Sanzoin Open Period: 2016 April 1 - June 30, Aug 13-15, Sept 16 - Nov 30 2017 Jan 1 - 15, March 1 - 31 Closing Period: 2016 July 1 - Aug 12, Aug 16 - Sept 15, Dec 1 - 31 2017 Jan 16 - Feb 28
strTitle: Explore Toshodaiji & Yakushiji Temple, Bus Tour in Nara!

strIntroduction: See a more authentic, rural side of Okinawa on this tour of the southern area of the island. Visit the sacred Sefa-Utaki, a place of worship for the native Ryukyu religion. Then, choose between exploring the emerald Mibaru beach or learning about Okinawan culture and exploring caves at Okinawa World. Finally, stop by the Himeyuri Memorial, established in memory of the war nurses who perished during the Battle of Okinawa. You can then be dropped off at Naha Airport or back in town. This easy half-day tour is a great way to explore further afield or see a bit more of Okinawa before flying out! Children aged 3 or under may take part in the tour for free, as long as they sit on your lap. If open seats are available, they may use those seats freely. The following will be the schedule: 07:40 - 08:00 Pick-up Loisir Hotel at 7:40 Palette Kumoji at 7:50 Nansei Kanko Hotel at 8:00 * Please arrive at the pick-up location at least 10 minutes before the stated time. 09:00 Sefa Utaki Sacred Grove (40 min) This sacred grove used to be forbidden to all but the priests of the Ryukyu religion but is now open to the public. It has been designated as a World Heritage Site. On June 5 - 7 and October 31 - November 2, Sefa-Utaki will be closed to the public. Next, you can choose from the following 2 options: (75 min) Option 1: Okinawa World and Gyokusendo Cave (10:15 - 11:30) At Okinawa World, you can explore a recreated Okinawan village, and see shows of traditional Ryukyu music and dances. The Gyokusendo Cave are filled with huge stalactites and is a popular spot for visitors to Okinawa. Option 2: Mibaru Beach and Cafe Time (10:05 - 11:15) Stroll down the pristine sand of this lovely secluded beach, and perhaps dip your feet in the ocean. Why not have a drink at one of the beach-side cafes too? 12:00 Himeyuri Memorial (30 min) This monument was created in memory of the war nurses who perished during the Battle of Okinawa. 13:00 Drop-off at Naha Airport 13:15 Drop-off at Kencho-mae (Prefectural Office) The following conditions will apply: * Due to traffic conditions, the pick-up times, schedule and drop-off times may be subject to change. * The tour operator will not join the tour, but the bus guide will be on hand to guide you. * Depending on the number of participants, auxiliary seats may have to be used. * Entrance fees for Okinawa World, meals, drinks and boat rides are not included in the tour fee. * Mibaru beach cafes do not accept reservations. At peak times, it may be difficult to get a seat, for which we ask for your understanding. * Jun 16-18 & November 12-14 Sefa-Utaki will be closed, so instead the tour will go to Chinenmisaki Viewpoint. * The tour assistant only speaks Japanese, but will do his/her utmost to make sure non-Japanese speaking guests understand the meeting times.
strTitle: Enjoy Half-Day Cultural Bus Tour of Southern Okinawa!

strIntroduction: This tour is a half-day tour that will take you for a comfortable bus heading to the Ikaruga area of Nara, where you can find Nara’s most famous temples stand. You will be visiting the Horyuji Temple, where you can see the five story pagoda of Horyuji Temple, which is one of Nara’s symbols. You will explore the famous World Heritage site with many artifacts and national treasures within the Golden Pavillion and Yumenodo (The Hall of Dreams). Please note that the central gate will be closed due to construction. You will also be visiting the Chuguji Temple, which is located in the North of Horyuji Temple, where you can head back to the 7th Century of Japan to trace the history of Nara. The itinerary for the tour will be as follows: - 09:55-10:00 Start from JR Nara Station (at 9:55), or Kintetsu Nara Staion (10:00) Check in at the bus information center by 20 minutes before the bus starts. Horyuji Temple Chuguji Temple Tour Ends at Horyuji Temple Reservation is difficult to make, so we suggest you to use our reservation service to book with no hassles. Reservation is difficult to make, so we suggest you to use our reservation service to book with no hassles.
strTitle: Half-day Bus Tour To Horyuji Temple & Chuguji Temple, Nara!

strIntroduction: Join this tour and head back to the 6th Century to discover ancient of Nara by visiting the Omiwa Shrine and Ishibutai Tomb. Also enjoy biking around the village or riding the bus around Asuka for an extended cultural experience! This tour will take you to the Asuka area of Nara, where you can head back to the 6th Century to discover the ancient of Nara through your visits to Omiwa Shrine and Ishibutai Tomb You will be visiting Omiwa Shrine, which is located on Mt. Miwa. At Omiwa Shrine, you can discover the history of one of the first Shinto Shrines in Japan and see the unique triple Torii Gates. You will also be visiting the Ishibutai Kofun Tomb, where you can explore the colossal ancient burial mound, which is believed to be the tomb of Soga no Umako, one of the associates of Prince Shotoku. The itinerary for this tour will be as follows: - 09:10-09:15 Start from JR Nara Station (at 9:10), or Kintetsu Nara Station (9:15) Check in at bus information center by 20 minutes before the bus departure time Omiwa Shrine Ishibutai Kofun Tomb - Tour Ends at Around 12:15 at Ishibutai Kofun Tomb Reservation is difficult to make, so we suggest you to use our reservation service to book with no hassles.
strTitle: Visit Asuka's Shinto Highlights in Nara in a Half-Day Tour!

strIntroduction: Visit Nara, one of the oldest prefecture in Japan that famous for its temples, which are included in The World Heritage Sites! You will be visiting Todaiji Temple, which is considered as the largest wooden building in the world, which is also the home of the Giant Buddha Statue. You will also have the chance to explore Kasuga Taisha Shrine, the colorful shrine that famous for its thousands of lanterns. The deer of Nara is believed to be the messengers of this shrine’s God. You will also be visiting Koufukuji Treasure House, which is the inner temples and the treasure house of Sarusawa Lake. You will also have the chance to see the gorgeous views of Wakakusayama and Forest of Kasuga from the bus window! The itinerary for this tour will be as follows: - 09:05-09:10 Start from JR Nara Station (at 9:05), or Kintetsu Nara Station (9:10) Check in at bus information center by 20 minutes before the bus departure time Todaiji Temple Kasuga Taisha Shrine Koufukuji Treasure House Wakakusayama (from bus window) Primeval forest of Kasuga (from bus window) Drop Offs at Kintentsu and JR Nara Stations - Arrive at Kintetsu Nara Station at 12:45. - Arrive at JR Nara Station at 12:50. strIntroduction: Change into the exercise wear you brought with you and we will start the training. First we will teach you one secret breathing exercise of Goi-Jyu Ryu Karate. For this experience, come to our restaurant in Chiba. It is about 5 minutes walk from JR Chiba Station. Kaiseki is traditional Japanese cuisine from the Edo period. Did you know that in Japan, we have not only 4, but 72 different seasons traditionally? We express the beauty of those seasons in our cuisine. Food is all organic, no additives are used. We think food makes your body healthier and we serve only good food for you. We also have calligraphy experience, flower arrangement experience, tea ceremony experience, special kimono experience, sushi making experience, Aikido experience, and Japanese music instrument experience for you. Please, check them also from our profile. Thank you!

strIntroduction: This is a half-day tour to the local cities of Shimada and Kanaya in Shizuoka prefecture, Japan. Meet at Shimada Station of Tokaido local line in the early afternoon. I will pick you up at the south exit of the station. First, we will visit the Houraibashi bridge. With its length of 897.4 meters (approx.0.6 miles) and width of 2.4 meters (approx. 6 feet) it is listed in the Guinness Book of Records as the world's longest wooden footbridge. You can cross that bridge on foot. After walking I will drive you to the Ooi Shrine, where you can experience the Shinto prayer, and enjoy Japanese architecture & garden. Next you will visit the Shimada City Museum and Ruins of the Ooi river Crossing Toll Gate. Strolling around the old streets will take you back to the old age of the Edo period. Also, you can see the ordinary people's life of Showa period. You can also enjoy an woodblock print exhibition. If you like to buy some souvenirs, I can take you to good places to shop. Or you can rest with a cup of coffee. I can guide 1-4 people.
strTitle: Time slip to the Edo period with a local tour in Shizuoka

strIntroduction: This is a one day, round-trip tour from Okayama city to the ruins of Takeda Castle, including a delicious Japanese lunch. There are two meeting points; Kurashiki and Okayama station south parking area. Itinerary 6:30-7:55 Board the bus at your preferred location and head to Takeda Castle ruins. You will stop en route to the castle to indulge in a traditional Japanese lunch consisting on beef and abalone. Once at the site, you will be amazed at the magnificent panorama of the ruins at the top of the mountain, covered in clouds, making it look like a floating castle in the sky. This castle was built in the 15th century and it's mystic appearance has earned it the nickname "The Machu Picchu of Japan". After the visit, you will head back by bus to Okayama to be dropped off at your preferred meeting point.
strTitle: Enjoy a 1-day tour of the Takeda Castle ruins from Okayama!

strIntroduction: This is a two day tour departing from Tokyo to western Japan, visiting iconic sights like the Himeji Castle, the Takeda Castle ruins, as well as central Kobe. Itinerary DAY 1 9:30 am Departure from Tokyo's Haneda airport on a direct flight to Osaka's Itami Airport, where you will then transfer to a boat cruise to explore Kobe port and take in the magnificent views of the city from the water. You will then stroll around Kobe's Kitano district, home to enormous residences featuring Western style architecture. This is where some of the first foreigner diplomats and expats settled in Japan back in the Meiji era. You will then check-in at Hotel Monterey Kobe, and then you'll have the rest of the day free to explore Kobe on your own. Your hotel is situated in the bustling downtown area, within walking distance to another Kobe sight: Chinatown. An area filled with Chinese restaurants that is perhaps most enjoyed by eating several small-sized bites delicacies at different stores such as Peking duck rolls or dumplings. For dinner, you could perhaps find a fine restaurant to try the world-famous Kobe beef and treat yourself to a delicious steak. For an extra fee, you could head to the Arima hot spring situated on top of Mt. Rokko, offering you magnificent views of this vibrant city while you relax in hot water. (towel included). DAY 2 Have breakfast at your hotel and check-out. You will then visit the ruins of Takeda castle, built in the 15th century, it's located at the top of a mountain, which is why it has earned the nickname "The Machu Picchu of Japan" Then, you will visit Himeji Castle, a UNESCO World Heritage Site and a National Treasure of Japan. It is finally open after years of restoration. Don't forget to visit Koko-en garden as well. After the visit, you will flight back to Tokyo Haneda airport where the tour ends.
strTitle: Visit Himeji and Takeda Castles in a 2-Day Tour from Tokyo!

strIntroduction: This is a walking sightseeing tour of Kobe with a visit to Nada sake brewery, including buffet style lunch!, the perfect way to explore this area of Japan in a single day. The tour participants will meet at Sannomiya Terminal Hotel in Kobe, where they will start the walking tour. You will head to Kitano Ijinkan District, famous for the several Western architecture residences built during the Meiji area that served as the home to first diplomats and expats who settled in Japan. The tour will then move on to the ANA Crown Plaza Kobe Hotel where you will enjoy a buffet style Western & Japanese lunch, before heading to Meriken Park, dotted with unique artwork and located right in front of the sea, with panoramic views of the port and landmarks such as the Kobe tower. You will also have some time to do some shopping in the area. You will then go back to Sannomiya Station where you'll take the Hanshin line train to Sumiyoshi station to visit the Hakutsuru Sake Brewery Museum, where you'll learn about the different methods for making sake and will have a chance to taste this delicious wine rice. Finally you will board a train at Sumiyoshi Station that will bring you back to Kobe Sannomiya station.
strTitle: Enjoy Kobe in a walking tour and visit a sake brewery!

strIntroduction: This is a walking sightseeing tour of Kobe with a visit to Nada sake brewery, including buffet style lunch!, the perfect way to explore this area of Japan in a single day, with a round-trip tour departing from Osaka. The tour participants will meet at Hotel Granvia Osaka and walk to JR Osaka station to board a 30 minute train ride to Kobe's Sannomiya Station. In Kobe you will walk around Kitano Ijinkan District, famous for the several Western architecture residences built during the Meiji area that served as the home to first diplomats and expats who settled in Japan. You will also have some time to do some shopping in the area.
