strIntroduction: On this 1 day tour with an English guide in Kyoto, you can ride the Sagano Romantic Train, stroll around Arashiyama including Tenryuji Temple, a UNESCO World Heritage site, visit a bamboo forest, and enjoy a Hozugawa River Boat Ride! To start this exciting tour, you will visit Tenryuji Temple which was established in 1339 and was Japan's first Zen temple and was designated as a UNESCO World Heritage building in 1994. At Tenryuji Temple you can see beautiful gardens and historical buildings such as Hatto (Dharma Hall), Kuri (Temple Living Quarters), Hojo (Abbot's Quarters), and more. You will be especially excited if you are interested in learning the history of Japan! Next, you will visit the bamboo forest, which is one of the most popular tourist spots in Kyoto. Here you can see thousands of bamboos lining the path making the experience feel like you are in a fantasy story. The photos you take here will be a great souvenir to show your family and friends! After 10 minutes walking from the bamboo forest, you will be able to take a ride on the Sagano Romantic Train! From the train, you can see the fascinating scenery of Arashiyama and the Hozugawa River which will be your next stops. The Hozugawa River Boat Ride will be an unforgettable memory of your Kyoto trip! On the boat, you will enjoy an exciting 16 kilometer, two hour journey! During all seasons, you can see the beautiful view: Cherry blossoms falling in the river wind in spring, Rock azalea and frogs singing in summer, gorgeous red autumn leaves in autumn, and the ravine with snow in winter. Don't miss this chance to fully enjoy Kyoto with this day trip! This tour is available everyday. Itinerary: Meet your guide at Kyoto station Move to JR Sagano-Arashiyama station by train (20min) Visit Tenryuji Temple and stroll the bamboo forest (60 min) Ride on the Sagano Romantic Train from Trocco Arashiyama station (25 min) Arrive at Trocco Kameoka station Move to Kameoka boarding area by bus Enjoy Hozugawa River Boat Ride! (120 min) Arrive at Arashiyama drop-off point Walk to JR Sagano-Arashiyama station (15 min) Get back at Kyoto station by train (20 min) *This tour ends at Kyoto station. Please go to your next destination on your own. The price only includes the Guide Fee. In addition to the price, there are other fees depending on your tour. Admission Fee: 600 JPY (Adlut) / 400 JPY (Child:Age 6-11) Transportation Fee: About 1400 JPY (Adult) / 860 JPY (Child:Age 6 -11) / 550 JPY (Infant:Age 0-5) Activity Fee: 4100 JPY (Adult) / 2700 JPY (Child: Age 0 -11)
strTitle: Enjoy Sagano Trocco, Stroll Arashiyama&River Boat Ride,Kyoto

strIntroduction: Due to the cold weather, cherry blossom season in Hokkaido often comes later than other areas of Japan, which offers a great opportunity for tourists to experience once more, such a beautiful scenery. Visit Shibazakura Takinoue Park to wander through the endless field of adorable pink blossoms that bloom only for a short period of time, creating a unique landscape. Then we'll head to Kamiyubetsu Tulip Park and take into the fabulous view of 1.2 million tulips creating a gorgeous flower carpet. And don't forget to enjoy a bento lunch and some local sweets as you enjoy the spring time season.
strTitle: Tour Hokkaido's Spring Flower Gardens

strIntroduction: Once departed from Sapporo Station Bus Terminal, we'll head towards our first destination - Okurayama Ski Jump Site. We will pass numerous famous sightseeing spots of the city, such as the Former Hokkaido Government Office Building, Odori Park, Former Sapporo Archives, Hokkaido Governor's Official Residence, Hokkaido Museum of Modern Art and Hokkaido Shrine. Please listen to the detailed instruction provided by our audio guide when you drive along these spots. Once reaching our destination, we'll spend about 1-hour to visit the Ski Jump Site from the 1972 Sapporo Winter Olympics, and take a cable car to the top and enjoy fantastic views of Sapporo city. Passing by Mt. Moiwa and the Munich Bridge over Toyohira River, we'll arrive at Hitsujigaoka Observation Hill, from which you can enjoy a great view of the rural and urban areas in Hokkaido and also the magnificent scenery of the Ishikari Plain and Sapporo Dome.
strTitle: Sapporo City View From Okurayama and Hitsujigaoka Hill Tour

strIntroduction: Particularly known as "The City of Food", Sapporo offers the best quality and fresh ingredients either in field farming, rice farming, dairy farming, or fishing industries. In our 1-day tour, you will have a pleasure to taste some of the most signature Sapporo's dishes. Once departed from Sapporo Station Bus Terminal, the tour will pass by several sightseeing spots, such as Former Hokkaido Government Office Building, Former Sapporo Appellate Court and Hokkaido Museum of Modern Art before heading to our first destination: Sapporo Central Wholesale Market. Spend some time for shopping and tasting sushi and fresh caught seafood here. Then move to Okurayama Ski Jump Site, take a chairlift to the top and enjoy the city view here, or go to Hitsujigaoka Observation Hill - a popular observatory spot from which you can have great views of Hokkaido too. After having lunch at Susukino Ramen Yokocho, visit Mt. Moiwa Ropeway and Morris Cable Car, and Shiroi Koibito Park where you can buy the popular cookies souvenir from the local chocolate company. Those who book our dinner tour will have a lamb buffet BBQ at Sapporo Beer Garden. In addition, you can use our bus ticket stub to get a discount from several restaurants and attraction spots as follow: 1. Get a 10% discount on the admission fee to the Winter Sports Museum. You can also get a 50 JPY discount on soft serve ice cream. 2. At the Central Market show the bus ticket stub and enjoy 1,500 JPY special dishes at the participating restaurants listed below: ・Mercado Kitchen Mar: Special rice bowl (5 tasting dishes and dessert) ・Tairyo Sushi Wakakoma: Seafood Set (sushi or sashimi and scallop rice bowl, salad, and soup) ・Kita-no Gourmet-tei: Crab and salmon roe rice bowl, sashimi, nori kurage and crab soup ・Ume-e Dou: Daily special sashimi rice bowl and crab soup ・Kita-no Shun: Sea urchin and salmon roe rice bowl with soup ・Kikusui Restaurant: Mackerel Set (with sea urchin or salmon roe) ・Kikusui Sushi: Crab, scallop, and salmon roe rice bowl ・Ofukuro Shokudo: Salmon and roe rice bowl ・Higuma: Manpuku Set ・Ajidokoro Nikkai: Chuo rice bowl ・Aji no Nikou: Pickled squid rice bowl Set ・Kita no Ryouba: 5-topping rice bowl ・Kyouei Suisan: Kaisen rice bowl ・Mandara: Original soup curry ・Kita no Shun Sushi: Sushi of the day ・Meshiya: Special 5-topping rice bowl 3. Get 5-10% discount from Itou Bussan, Iwamoto Store,Okada Store, Kanisen, Kanetai, Kitano Ryoba No.1-3 branches, Kyoei Shokudo, Tokusanbutu Hanbai, Nagamine Suisan, Nikkai No.1~3 branches, Nemuro Kani Ichiba, Hasegawa Seika, Fujimoto Saketen, Fujimoto Seika,Matsumoto Bussan.
strTitle: Discover the Real Taste of Sapporo in a 1-day Food Tour

strIntroduction: You might have seen a person standing up paddling a surfboard somewhere in a river or the ocean on TV before. This is a tour in which you can try it for yourself in Tokyo. Unlike traditional surfing where the rider sits until a wave comes, SUP standup paddle boarders maintain an upright stance on their boards and use a paddle to propel themselves through the water. This sport is growing in popularity all over the world. This is an activity you can learn and try at Nakagawa River in Tokyo and is good for beginners. It takes about 1 hour and 15 minutes to be able to start paddling on a board. It is the "in" sport right now that you must try in Tokyo. Schedule: Tokyo SUP Tour (for beginners): Weekday: 07:00, 09:00, 11:00 Weekend & Holiday: 07:00, 15:30 Duration: 1 hour 15 mins Optional Tours: Sky Tree SUP Tour (people who have experiences only): Weekday: 9:00 / 11:00 Weekend & Holiday : 9:00. Duration: 1 hour 45 mins Tokyo Canal SUP Tours (at least 3 days experience of SUP) Weekday: 13:30 Weekend & Holiday: 13:30 Duration: 3 hours 15 mins Sky Tree Night SUP Tour (people who have experiences only). 18:30 [Remarks] *The activity will be canceled only in case of heavy rain or natural disaster. *It will be regarded as no show if you delayed 30 minutes or more. *Please be ready for the activity wearing comfortable clothes. Hiking clothes, sportswear and outdoor clothes are recommended. The material should be man‐made fiber. If you wear jeans pants, chino pants, skirt or any cotton clothes, you might be rejected to join to the activity for the safety reason. *If you join the activity without shoes or socks, please keep your nails short. You may wear socks or can borrow socks from the host. *If your nails are long, you will be rejected for safety reason.
strTitle: Enjoy the Tokyo SUP (Stand Up Paddle) Experience!

strIntroduction: This is a unique tour in which you'll paddle a canoe in Nakagawa River and enjoy sightseeing at the same time. This gives you a totally different way to go around the city. Unlike a tour bus, this will be a special trip in a relaxed form. Meet at the Komatsugawa Park parking area and you will be provided a life jacket. There will be a lecture regarding the basics, such as how to paddle, stop, and backing for about 10 minutes. You'll enter the river with a partner and start to paddle. You will find the scenery is totally different from the water level perspective and enjoy the nature. After a while, you will see Tokyo Skytree from head to toe which is very rare anywhere in Tokyo. Enjoy a relaxed time and slowly head to the place you started from. If you like an outdoor activity, this is a must-try trip. You will experience nature and enjoy sightseeing at the same time. Schedule: 06:30, 09:00, 11:00, 13:30, 15:30, 17:30. ※The afternoon time slots (13:30 and 15:30) are not available from July.12 to the middle of September due to high temperature. Tokyo Skytree Canoe Night Tour. After 19:00. 1 hours 45 mins.
strTitle: Enjoy an Outdoor Adventure with Tokyo Skytree Canoe Tour!

strIntroduction: Recently, Japanese animation is becoming more popular in foreign countries. It's an interesting way to learn the Japanese language and the culture through animation. Four-M, a photo studio in Osaka, offers a great opportunity to explore Japanese culture through a photo shoot with a costume. It takes approximately 1 minute to walk to the studio from Nipponbashi station of Sennichimae Line and Sakaisuji Line. On a reservation, select the plan that suits your schedule. They have 3 plans with optional items, allowing you to arrange a special photo shoot just for you. Once you get to the photo studio, select your costume and photo booth. Dress up in your favorite and get your make up done, then say cheese! A professional photographer will take your best shot! After choosing a photo to be developed, the process is complete. Just take your photo and photo data with you as a wonderful memory! You'll keep it along with your photo. Here are the details of 3 plans. 1. Plan Bamboo (Basic Plan) It takes about 35 minutes to complete the process. The plan includes ・Photo shoot by a professional photographer ・One choice of costume ・Two choices of photo booth ・All the photo data for your SNS ・One picture 2. Plan Pine (Multiple Costumes Plan) It takes about 60-90 minutes to complete the process. The plan includes ・Photo shoot by a professional photographer ・All the costumes you can use ・All the photo booths you can use ・All the photo data for your SNS ・Two pictures 3. Family Plan/1 group (4-5 people) It takes about 60-120 minutes to complete the process. The plan includes ・Photo shoot by a professional photographer ・All the costumes you can use ・All the photo booths you can use ・All the photo data for your SNS ・Two pictures per person ・One original calendar The calendar needs 2 hours to be printed out, so you may possibly need to arrange another date for pick-up. Four-M has an option to kindly mail it to your home. Please confirm about it. Four-M is opened daily from 10 AM to 8 PM. All the photo shooting plans need a reservation.
strTitle: Dress Up as Your Favorite Character For Photography in Osaka

strTitle: Afternoon Tour to Explore Sapporo's Best Highlights

By the end of the tour, we will go pass Hokkaido Governer's Official Residence, Hokkaido Museum of Modern Art, and drop off at Sapporo Clock Tower, the oldest building in Sapporo and is one of the last surviving Western-style structures from the Meiji era.
strTitle: Explore Sapporo's Best Highlights and Taste Local Cuisine

strIntroduction: As fans of martial arts movies will know, the ninja were the special forces of feudal Japan, experts in infiltration, sabotage, and silent killing. But there was more to being a ninja than skulking in the shadows, and these courses at Ninja Dojo in Kyoto offer original and unique training in meditative and composure techniques, as well as experience of ninja weapons. Basic Ninja Course: A 1-hour entry-level class that teaches breathing techniques, how to move like a ninja, 'Kuji-In' meditation mantras, how to use kunai daggers and ninja swords, as well as shuriken and ninja blow darts training. Advanced Ninja Training Course: A 2-hour course combining the 1-hour entry level course with a 1-hour advanced skills course. Learn to use ninja weapons and practice kusarigama (chain-sickle), kunai with rope, ninja sword with shuriken, rope techniques, and stick type shuriken. Major credit cards accepted. Prices include: Ninja costumes rental for lessons; private hands-on lessons; and lessons in English. Self-photography is permitted free of charge, or there is a photo shooting service during training by staff for an additional fee. Ninja Dojo and Store is open from 10:00 to 18:00 - admission is free. Access: 3 minutes on foot from Shijo-Karasuma Station on the Hankyu Kyoto Line.
strTitle: Enjoy The Ninja Training Dojo and Items Store in Kyoto!

strIntroduction: Kyoto is well known for its superior cuisine derived from the seasonal bounty of nature, Buddhist traditions, and Imperial court banqueting. These cooking classes teach an appreciation for ingredients, their preparation, and presentation that is pleasing to the senses, not just the taste buds! Japanese Vegetarian Cooking Class: With an emphasis on the traditional (Buddhist) appreciation for natural, seasonal flavours, participants will learn to prepare four or five delicious vegetarian dishes, and how to artfully present them in true Japanese style. The course takes around 3-4 hours, from preparation to cooking to eating. It beings at 14:00 (2:00 P.M.) Japanese non-Vegetarian Cooking Class (with Kobe beef): Kobe beef, with its distinctive marbled appearance, is renowned for superior flavour and tenderness. Naturally, preparing and cooking such a prized and expensive ingredient requires a special kind of approach. On this course, you will learn how to cook Kobe beef in one of two sizes as part of a three or four-course meal. The course takes around 3-4 hours, from preparation to cooking to eating. It beings at 14:00 (2:00 P.M.) Further information: The menu is seasonal (subject to change) and organized as a complete meal. Maximum of 6 guests per class. Payment: cash only. Access by city bus number 205 (loop line) to "Shin Aoibashi" stop.
strTitle: Learn to Cook Delicious Japanese Food in Kyoto!
